loans.name: Gad

texts.en: Gad is 27 years old, and he is not married. He has a shop and has been in business for 10 years. After getting his loan, he would like to buy more rice and sugar to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy more rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Appolinaire

texts.en: Appolinaire is 27 years old, and he is not married. He has a bar and has been in business for 10 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more soda and wine to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy more soda and wine to sell.

loans.name: Yeimi Astrid

texts.es:
Yeimi ha sido una ama de casa muy dedicada, siempre pendiente del cuidado de su familia conformada por su hijo y su esposo; desde siempre le ha gustado trabajar como comerciante independiente, comenzó a vender mercancía desde hace 5 años, pues es responsable de llevar la carga económica del hogar junto con su esposo y necesita generar los recursos para hacerlo. 

Sus clientes son vecinos, familiares y amigos del sector, trabaja sola todos los días en su negocio y encuentra en su labor la ventaja de poder estar pendiente de su familia, al mismo tiempo que logra ser productiva como comerciante.

Actualmente solicita el crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor de ropa para dama y caballero y ropa intima, pues es una gran oportunidad en esta época del año, esto le permitirá abastecerse con más variedad para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en la temporada de navidad, dando como resultado la obtención de mejores ingresos para su familia.

Yeimi manifiesta que su mayor deseo es poder seguir apoyando económicamente a su familia y dar educación a su hijo, para verlo convertirse en profesional y tenga un futuro próspero y exitoso.
texts.en:
Yeimi has been a very devoted mother and homemaker, always attending to the care of her family: her husband and their son. She has also always enjoyed working as an independent businesswoman, having begun selling merchandise five years ago. Yeimi is responsible for managing the familiy's finances, along with her husband, and needs to generate the income her family needs. 

Yeimi's customers are neighbors, relatives, and friends who live nearby. She works on her own each day and finds that working at her business allows her to be available to her family while she's working productively at her business.  

Yeimi is applying for a loan to  purchase men's and women's clothing and underwear. The end of the year presents a great opportunity, and a loan will allow her to stock a greater variety of items to satisfy the higher demand during the Christmas season. This investment will thus allow Yeimi to earn higher income for her family. 

Yeimi says that her greatest wish is to be able to continue supporting her family financially and provide for her son's education. She wants him to have a  prosperous successful future in a professional career.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale men's and women's clothing and underwear.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago tiene 39 años de edad, vive junto a su cónyuge y sus dos menores hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el Distrito de Pimpingos, ubicado en la Provincia de Cutervo, Región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú. Esta es una comunidad de clima caluroso, sus pobladores son amables y se dedican principalmente al cultivo de frutales, café, maíz y hortalizas, así como a la ganadería y al comercio.

El se dedica a brindar servicios de carpíntería desde hace 2 años, elabora mesas, puertas, sillas y muebles según los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, es conocido por esta labor ya que realiza un buen trabajo. Cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El presente crédito será utilizado para la compra de madera como cedro, roble, entre otros, así como para la compra de más herramientas para su negocio, con esto Santiago espera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que se verá reflejado en un mayor nivel de ingresos y le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Santiago is 39 years old, lives with his spouse and their two children in their own home constructed from rustic materials in the Pimpingos District within the located in the Province of Cutervo within the Cajamarca region located in the Northern highlands of Peru. 

It is a community of warm climate, people are friendly and mainly engaged in the cultivation of fruit, coffee, corn and vegetables and livestock and trade.
He works providing carpentry services, and has done so  for the last two years, producing tables, doors, chairs and furniture to fill orders that his customers make. He is well-known for his work because he does it well. He enjoys experience in the industry and has very good personal and work references from the area. 

This loan will be used to purchase wood like cedar, oak, and other woods, as well as to buy more tools for his business. With this loan, Santiago hopes to render better services to his customers which will translate into a higher income to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: purchase wood like cedar and oak and other woods, as well as buying more tools for the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals and ground nuts.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
For more than a year Theresa, a 43-year-old mother of five, has had a small business sewing clothes and selling them in her community to earn a living. She has requested a loan to buy  rolling materials, needles, a sewing machine and tape measurement to help her with the business. 

Theresa will use her profits to expand her enterprise. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, needles, a sewing machine and tape measurement

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase stock for her mamalishe.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is 37 years old with five children. She owns and operates a small business of cooking and selling BBQ in her community to earn a living. Theresa has requested a loan to buy a box of chicken, box of sausage, mushroom soy sauce, onions, plates, aluminum foil, banana, sack of rice to help her run the business. She hopes to build a small restaurant in the near future using her business profits. She became a member of SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, box of sausage, mushroom soy sauce, onions, plates, aluminum foil, bananas and sacks of rice

loans.name: Lily Del Milagro

texts.es:
Lily tiene 35 años de edad, es soltera, vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Buenos Aires, ubicado en la provincia de Morropón, región Piura, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila, los pobladores del distrito se dedican al comercio y crianza de ganado menor como sustento principal.

El se dedica a la venta de cerveza y abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, entre otros, cuenta con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El destino del crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos como gaseosas, arroz, azúcar, golosinas, entre otros, para incrementar el stock de su negocio. Con esto Lily espera satisfacer los gustos y preferencias de sus clientes lo que le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ventas, por ende logrará obtener mayores ingresos y mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lily is 35 years old. She is single, and she lives with her parents in the Buenos Aires district, which is located in the Morropon province, which belongs to the Piura region in the northern coast of Peru. Life in this community is peaceful. The people of this district work in commerce and small livestock as their main source of income.

She makes a living selling beer and groceries such as rice, sugar, oil, and pasta, among other things. She relies on more than 5 years of experience in this business as well as very good personal and professional references in the area. She will use this loan to buy a greater quantity of products such as sodas, rice, sugar, and snacks, among other things, in order to increase the stock of her business. With this, Lily hopes to satisfy the tastes and preferences of her customers, which will allow her to increase her sales and, therefore, to earn a higher income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of products such as sodas, rice, sugar, and snacks, among other things, in order to increase the stock of her business.

loans.name: Cristian Adalberto

texts.es:
Cristian, de 28 años de edad, estudió bachillerato,está acompañado, ella se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene una hija de un año, no tienen casa propia por lo tanto alquilan casa.


Cristian, trabaja de motorista desde hace dos años y su horario de trabajo es de lunes a sábado de 5:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m.
 
Cristian, solicita el préstamo para comprar medicinas para su hija y  hacerle una radiografiá, de esa forma su familia estará en mejores condiciones y la salud de su hija será estable.

Los sueños de Cristian, es ver a su hija sana y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cristian is 28 years old, has a high school education and lives with his partner. She is a housewife and has a one-year-old daughter. They don't have their own home so they rent.

Cristian has been working as a driver for two years and his work hours are from Monday to Saturday, 5:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.
 
Cristian is requesting the loan in order to buy medicines for his daughter and have an x-ray taken. That way, their family will be in better circumstances and their daughter's health will be stable.

Cristian's dream is to see his daughter healthy and to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy medicines for his daughter and have an x-ray taken.

loans.name: Loreli

texts.en:
Loreli is grateful that she was granted a 40,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. She is glad that through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 50,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy large quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, pasta, beverages, rice noodles and frozen foods which she sells at retail. She expects a higher demand for grocery items now that Christmas is just around the corner. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given to her. She is wishing everyone a Blessed Christmas!

Loreli dreams of having a grocery store someday. She wants to see her children earn a college degree and become professionals. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Nileke Group

texts.en:
Luttigery, who is in his late 30s, is married with three children; two of them are in school and one is still small. He has been selling fish for two years now.  He works from 6am to 8pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Luttigery's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to increase his stock of fish. He dreams of owning a hotel.

Luttigery will share this loan with his loan group "Nileke" which has thirteen members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase his stock of fish.

loans.name: Kimorn's Group

texts.en: Kimorn’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Kimorn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Darn's Group

texts.en: Darn’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Darn makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a tailor and village coordinator to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Lai's Group

texts.en:

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a room in her house.

loans.name: Winnie Jane

texts.en:
Her name is Winnie Jane, 27, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jayson, a security guard, and has two children, of which one is in the Preparatory level and the other one is not of school age yet. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal household needs and to send her child to school. 

Winnie is a dealer of soft drinks and a rice retailer as well. She buys them from a wholesaler and sells them at a retail price at her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 800 a day. 

To help her continue operation of her business she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan which she will use to buy sacks of rice and soft drinks to sell by her house. Rice is a staple in a Filipino household and soft drinks are also regularly taken in meals. She expects higher sales now that Christmas is just around the corner. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given to her.

Winnie Jane hopes to maintain and grow her business so she they could have a better life. She strives hard to send her child to school and prays for a quiet and happy married life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and cases of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Norma Angelica

texts.es: Norma payed her first loan on time and now is asking for a new loan to buy blankets, cover sheets and clothes to sell through catalog. She used to have a grocery store but decided that selling clothes and blankets could earn her more income. She has shown to be creditworthy by paying her first loan on time. She says that her biggest achievement has been supporting her husband and fixing her house.
texts.en: Norma repaid her first loan on time and now is asking for a new loan to buy blankets, cover sheets and clothes to sell through catalogs. She used to have a grocery store but decided that selling clothes and blankets could earn her more income. She has shown herself to be credit-worthy by repaying her first loan on time. She says that her biggest achievement has been supporting her husband and fixing her house.

loans.use: to purchase blankets and clothes to sell through catalogs.

loans.name: Sefau

texts.en:
For more than two years Sefau, a 49-year-old mother of four, has operated a small business selling fish in her community to earn a living. She has requested a loan to buy fishing gear, a canoe, fishing net, containers, ice bag and torch to help her in the business. 

Sefau hopes to use her profits to expand her enterprise and provide for family needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2010.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear, a canoe, fishing net, containers, ice bag and torch

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.en: Maria Esther is 57 years old. She is married and has three independent sons. She sells home products such as blankets, bed covers, etc. through catalogs. She is asking for a loan to get new models to offer her clients. She has been selling through catalog for more than 15 years and says that she has never missed a loan payment. Her biggest achievement has been supporting her husband and sending her sons to school.

loans.use: to buy blankets and bed covers for catalog sales.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
María Esperanza tiene 48 años de edad, es casada, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Nueva Arica, en una zona rural, su población se dedica al cultivo de manzanas, maíz, comercio de animales menores y transporte como actividades económicas principales.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral como gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio está ubicado en la parte posterior a su domicilio, con los ingresos apoya a su esposo con los gastos familiares. Cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Ha solicitado un préstamo para realizar reparaciones del lugar donde cría a sus animales así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos, con esto María Esperanza espera tener una mayor variedad de animales para ofrecer a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos y le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
María Esperanza is 48 years old and married. She lives with her husband and two children in the district of Nueva Arica, in a rural area where people earn a living by farming apples and corn, raising small animals, and providing transportation. Those are the main economic activities.

She raises and sells poultry, such as chickens, ducks, and turkeys among others. Her business is located behind her home, she is experienced in this work and has very good work and personal references in the area. With her earnings, she helps her husband with the household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to repair the area where she raises the animals, and also to buy balance feed for fattening them. 

María Esperanza is looking to have as a result a greater variety of animals that she can offer for sale. This will bring her more income, thus allowing her to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to repair the area where she raises her animals, and also to buy balanced feed to fatten them.

loans.name: Bunyonyi Ageteraine Group

texts.en: Kenneth is a member of Bunyonyi Ageteraine Group, where members guarantee each other to get a loan. He is a married man living in Fort Portal Uganda. He runs a butcher shop, while also farming to supplement his income. He faces challenges including the fluctuating prices of cows on the market and prolonged drought where animals lack pastures and water. However, he hopes to construct a good house for his family. Kenneth needs a loan to buy cows to slaughter and sell.

loans.use: to buy a cow to slaughter and sell.

loans.name: Ireneo

texts.en:
His name is Ireneo, 64, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Jocelyn. He manages their household while operating his van. They work hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ireneo operates a van rental business. He has one van that he offers to be rented for transportation service or for people who need a van for out of town service. He provides services within the city and nearby provinces. In addition to this he also sells RTW products for additional income. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 3000 in sales every week. Ireneo owns and oversees operation of his van.

To help him continue operations of his business, Ireneo is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan which he will use for repairs and maintenance of his van. It is very important that his unit is always in good running condition to ensure efficient service. He thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given him. He wishes everyone a Blessed New Year!

Ireneo hopes that their transport service will continue to be successful. He desires for a happy and victorious life. Every week, he faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to maintain his van for rent.

loans.name: San's Group

texts.en:
San’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. San makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of her family and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Phin's Group

texts.en: Living in a rural area of the Kampong Speu province, Phin is 50 years old and the mother of two children. Nowadays, she grows rice as a single source of income. She can earn an income of about 20,000 KHR per day. For Phin, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of four members to get new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can improve her family's healthy living.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

location.town: Kampong Speu province, Samrong Torng district

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en: Phalla, 34, lives with family members in Kampong Speu province and is a mother of four children. To support her family's living expenses, she grows rice and her husband is a house builder. She can earn about 25,000 KHR per day in income. In this group of seven, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can improve her family's living to give them good health.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

location.town: Kampong Speu province, Samrong Torng district

loans.name: Las Artesanas Del Fresno Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad del Estado de México se formó un grupo llamado “Las Artesanas del Fresno” haciendo referencia a que cinco de ellas se dedican a la elaboración de bordados artesanales, es una tradición que proviene de generaciones pasadas y que anteriormente se realizaba por gusto, actualmente, se ha convertido también en un medio de subsistencia.

Doña Porfiria es una persona muy seria pero muy amable, ella tiene 39 años de edad y está casada desde hace 20 con el señor Maximino quien trabaja en la construcción de casas, juntos han formado una familia con cuatro hijos de los cuales tres de ellos estudian y la más pequeña aún no asiste a la escuela.

Desde pequeña, Porfiria observaba a su abuela elaborar sus bordados artesanales, cada figura de la prenda tiene un toque mazahua, cultura indígena del lugar que representa años de tradiciones. Hace 20 años Porfiria hizo de esta actividad su negocio para ayudar con los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus hijos, pero necesita apoyo para comprar material como tela, agujas, hilo y estambre que transforma en colchas, suéteres, chalecos y rebozos que vende en distintas comunidades. Los diseños y la combinación de colores surgen con su creatividad.

Porfiria menciona que la mayoría de las mujeres en comunidad elaboran las mismas artesanías y puede resultar complicado vender, en ocasiones ha tenido que bajar los precios para obtener alguna ganancia durante el día. “Es muy triste saber que muchas personas no valoren nuestro trabajo, deben saber que nosotras mismas lo elaboramos”. Sin embargo, sabe que debe mejorar la calidad de las piezas y dejar volar la creatividad para tener más diseños porque su sueño es seguir creciendo para apoyar a sus hijos en los gastos de su educación y logren terminar una carrera profesional.

Las integrantes están muy contentas y agradecidas con KIVA y VisionFund porque su préstamo ayudará a mejorar sus negocios. Doña Angelina, Zenaida, Ma Luisa y Ma Alejandra comprarán materia prima para la elaboración de sus bordados artesanales, Jhynalin y Manuela invertirán en productos de belleza.

*La fotografía fue capturada en las escaleras debajo del quiosco del municipio y muestran algunas de sus artesanías. Porfiria es quien viste de color rosa.*
texts.en:
In a community in the State of Mexico, the communal bank " Las Artesanas del Fresno”  was  formed.  Their name makes reference to the fact that 5 of them work making handmade embroidered items.  This is tradition that comes from past generations, which previously was done for enjoyment.  Now, this has become a means of earning a living.

Porfiria is a very serious person who is also very friendly.  She's 39 years old, and has been married since she was 20 to Maximino, who works building houses.  Together they created a family with 4 children, 3 of whom are in school.  The youngest is not yet old enough to attend school.

From the time she was very young, Porfiria  used to watch her grandmother make handmade embroidered items, where every shape on the garment had a Manzahua touch.  This is the indigenous culture in this place, representing years of traditions.  Twenty years ago, Porfiria started doing this activity as a business to help with the household expenses and the education of her children.  However, she needs support to buy supplies such as fabric, needles, thread, and yarn to transform into quilts, sweaters, jackets, and shawls that she sells in various communities.  The designs and color combinations come from her own creativity.

Porfiria mentions that most of the women in her community make the same handicrafts, and so this can make it difficult to sell.  At times, she has had to lower her prices in order to obtain some earnings during the day.  "It is very sad to know that many people do not value our work, they should know that we make these items ourselves."  However, she knows that she must improve the quality of her pieces, and let her creativity flow so that she can create more designs, because her dream is to continue to grow her business to support her children with their educational expenses so that they can get a professional degree.  

The members of this group are very content and thankful to Kiva and VisionFund, because this loan will help them to improve their businesses.  Angelina, Zenaida, Ma Luisa and Ma Alejandra will buy raw materials to make their embroidered handicrafts, and Jhynalin and Manuela will invest in beauty products to sell. 

Note:  this photograph was taken on the steps below the municipal gazebo, and shows some of our artisans.  Porfiria is the one wearing pink.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials like fabric, needles, threads, and yarn.

loans.name: Felix Pedro

texts.es:
En las repisas del hogar de Don Félix  Pedro se exhiben todos los días  una variedad  de  productos que comercializa a todos los que habitan en su comunidad. A sus 53 años de edad se siente muy honrado de los resultados que le han brindado sus deseos de superación. Como todo  un varón emprendedor desea poner en práctica una estrategia  de financiamiento que le permita aumentar sus ganancias y clientela. Solicita préstamo para destinarlos a compras de productos tales como, granos básicos, productos de limpieza, bebidas, panadería, etc.  
El punto de localización de la pequeña pulpería de Félix es clave, ya que se encuentra cerca de una terminal de buses. Esto le ha permitido dar a conocer su producto a personas de otros lugares  que están viajando a diario. Entre sus planes esta amplificar la infraestructura de su casa completa y acondicionar el espacio del negocio para dar una mejor atención a todos sus consumidores.
texts.en:
Every day, the shelves of Félix Pedro's house display a variety of products that he sells to all those who live in his community. At 53 years old, he feels very honored by the results of his desire to better himself. Like all enterprising men, he would like to put into practice a financing strategy that will allow him to increase his earnings and clientele. He is requesting a loan with the objective of buying products such as staple foods, cleaning products, drinks, baked goods, etc.

The location of Félix's little neighborhood store is key, as it is situated close to a bus terminal. This has allowed him to make his products known to people from other places who are daily travelers. Among his plans are expanding the infrastructure of his whole house and setting up his business space in order to better serve all his consumers.

loans.use: to buy products like staple foods, cleaning products, drinks, baked goods, etc.

texts.en:
Naomi is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a hardware store, where she sells nails, paint, locks,  and other hardware items. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. 

Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital to buy more stock. She will use the 100,000 KES loan to buy more stock of the hardware items that she sells.This will enable her to have more stock to sell, hence increased profits. Her business goal is to expand well within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy more stock of hardware items she sells.

Like other Babban Gona members, Samaila is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Seybou

texts.fr: SEYBOU est né vers 1983 à KADIANA, une des sous-préfectures de la 3ème Région administrative du Mali .Mr SEYBOU est âgé de 31 ans avec 3 enfants; Mr SEYBOU réside à KADIANA dans une famille traditionnelle. Mr SEYBOU s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat et vente de d’aluminium pour la fabrication d’ustensiles de cuisine. Sa vente se fait à KADIANA. Fort de  ses 13 années d’expérience dans le domaine, il collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son  troisième prêt. Mr SEYBOU compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1 tonne d’aluminium. Il s’approvisionne à KADIANA et environnants, il effectue ses ventes au comptant et parfois à crédit à une clientèle mixte. Mr SEYBOU espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
SEYBOU was born around 1983 in KADIANA, a sub-prefecture of the 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali. He is 31 years old, has three children, and resides in KADIANA in a traditional family. Mr. SEYBOU quickly became interested in revenue-generating businesses, especially in the buying and selling of aluminum to make kitchen utensils. He makes his sales in KADIANA.

With thirteen years of good experience in the domain, he is collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to satisfy his customer base, which is every-growing. He is on his 3rd loan. 

Mr. SEYBOU intends to use his loan to purchase a tonne of aluminum. He gets his supplies in and around KADIANA. Accepting cash and sometimes credit, he makes his sales to a mixed customer base. Mr. SEYBOU hopes to make a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be used to meet family needs, pay back the loan, and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase aluminum to make kitchen utensils

loans.name: Patricia Esperanza

texts.es:
Patricia, de 20 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a vender CD de música y películas.

Patricia, se dedica a vender tortillas, está actividad la aprendió de su madre; decidio dedicarse a este negocio, debido  a la situación económica y para que su hijo tuviera lo necesario.- La venta de tortillas la realiza en su casa y su hermana le ayuda a repartir las tortillas a sus clientes.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar mas maíz y leña, para el negocio de Patricia, de está manera ella podrá tener los insumos básicos para hacer sus tortillas y mantener siempre satisfechos a sus clientes.

Los sueños de Patricia son, que sus ventas incrementen y que sus clientes también aumenten,.- Además, desea que sus hijos continúen estudiando y sean profesionales útiles para nuestro país.
texts.en:
20-year-old Patricia finished high-school and has a common-law partner. Her partner sells CDs with music and movies. 

Patricia works selling tortillas. She learned this occupation from her mother. She decided to work on this due to her financial situation and to offer her son all that he needs. She sells the tortillas at home and her sister helps deliver them to her customers.

She is requesting this loan to buy more corn and firewood for her business. This way, she will have the basic supplies to make her tortillas and keep her customers satisfied.

Patricia's dream is for her sales and customers to increase. She also wants her children to continue studying and to become professionals that will help their country.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

Faamaau has requested for a loan to buy taro, banana, vegetable oil, plastic bags, a frying pan, containers, a wooden spoon, and a sack of salt to run the business. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business. Faamaau became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy taro, banana, vegetable oil, plastic bags, a frying pan, containers, a wooden spoon, and a sack of salt.

loans.name: Akata

texts.en: Akata is a 44-year-old mother with five children. She owns and operates a small business selling pancakes, pork cakes, and buns in her village to earn a living. Akata has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, vegetable oil, a frying pan, a wooden spoon, plastic bags, and yeast for her business. She hopes to build a small bakery store in the near future using her profit. She joined SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, vegetable oil, a frying pan, a wooden spoon, plastic bags, and yeast

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en: Maribeth has mastered in making snacks to sell. "Bibingka" (rice cake) is the favorite home treat that her local customers would make high demands for. She seeks financial assistance form the Cooperative to finance additional capital to purchase raw ingredients for snack vending. Maribeth hopes to increase her income so that she can continuously support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for snack vending

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ice bags, sack of sugar, coolio, plastic bags, and containers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Maria Nohemi

texts.es:
María, de 25 años de edad, estudió contaduría publica,esta acompañada y su pareja vive en los estados unidos y tiene un hijo pequeño.

María, tiene muchos años dedicándose a vender lotería nacional, debido a la necesidad de obtener ingresos extras, decidió ayudarle un día a la semana a su hermana en la venta de ropa. 
 
El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar mas billetes de lotería para vender; de esa forma logrará tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su hijo.

El sueño de María es que su hijo crezca sano y estudie y pueda tener las oportunidades que ella no tuvo al de la universidad.
texts.en:
25-year-old Maria studied Public Accountancy. She has a common-law partner and a small child. Her partner lives in the United States.

Maria has worked selling lottery tickets for several years. Due to the need to have an additional income, she also decided to help her sister sell clothes once a week.

She will use this loan to buy more lottery tickets for sale. This will allow her to improve her quality of life and that of her son.

Maria's dreams are for her son to grow up healthy and for him to have an education and the opportunities that she did not have.

loans.use: to buy lottery tickets for sale.

loans.name: Siem's Group

texts.en: Siem’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Siem makes a living cultivating rice and also does extra work as a tailor to support their family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Samoeun's Group

texts.en: The members of Samoeun’s Group live in a rural village in the Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Samoeun makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as a factory laborer, to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these borrowers safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family

Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Nolovale

texts.en:
Nolovale is a 50 year old mother with one child.  She runs a business selling taro and bananas in her village. She has been doing this for more than a year to earn a living. 

Nolovale has requested a loan to buy taro roots, banana tubes, a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank and hand gloves to support the business. She will expand her business in the future using her profit.  Nolovale became a member of SPBD 2014.

loans.use: to buy taro roots, banana tubes, a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank and hand gloves.

loans.name: Leotele

texts.en: Leotele is a 45-year-old mother who has one child. She operates a small business, selling pancakes, pork cakes and buns in her village to earn a living. Leotele has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, a bottle of vegetable oil, a fry pan, a wooden spoon, plastic bags and yeast to help her run the business. She hopes to build a small bakery store in the near future using her profit. She joined SPBD in 2010.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, a bottle of vegetable oil, a fry pan, a wooden spoon, plastic bags and yeast.

loans.name: Tilomai

texts.en: Tilomai is 37 years old and she has three children. She owns and operates a small business, selling pork cakes, buns and pancakes in her village to earn a living. She joined SPBD in 2014. Tilomai has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, vegetable oil, yeast, a wooden spoon, a fry pan, plastic bags, containers and a box of chicken to assist her in running the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, vegetable oil, yeast, a wooden spoon, a fry pan, plastic bags, containers and chicken.

loans.name: Mitchelle

texts.en: Mitchelle has a home business in Liloy. Young as she is, she doubles her effort to make ends meet for her family. She has sought Paglaum MPC for her financial needs and was granted with her first loan to purchase more cosmetic inventories to sell. She hopes to sustain her business with the help of the cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetic inventories to sell

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en: Mareta is 48 years old with nine children. She owns and operates a small business selling ice cakes in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years. Mareta has requested a loan to buy an ice bag, sack of sugar, plastic bags, and containers to assist her in running the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. Mareta joined SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy an ice bag, sack of sugar, plastic bags, and containers

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 53 years old and is married with seven children, with one child in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Elsa has operated a dried fish making business in the Philippines for 10 years.  She has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional fish and some materials like bamboo and nails.

In the future, Elsa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish and some materials like bamboo and nails.

loans.name: Fogaupolu

texts.en: Fogaupolu is a 43-year-old mother who has four children. She owns and operates a small business, selling pancakes, pork cakes and buns in her village to earn a living. Fogaupolu has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, a bottle of vegetable oil, a fry pan, a wooden spoon, plastic bags and yeast to help her run the business. She hopes to build a small bakery store in the near future using her profit. She joined SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, a bottle of vegetable oil, a fry pan, a wooden spoon, plastic bags and yeast.

loans.name: Vaiomasina

texts.en:
Vaiomasina is a 32-year-old mother with 2 children.  She owns and operates a small business selling pancakes, pork cake, and buns in her village to earn a living.  

Vaiomasina has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, vegetable oil, fry pan, wooden spoon, plastic bags, and yeast to help her run her business.  She hopes to build a small bakery store in the near future using her profit.  She joined the South Pacific Business Development group in 2014.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, vegetable oil, fry pan, wooden spoon, plastic bags, and yeast.

loans.name: Maota

texts.en:
Maota is a 29-year-old mother with 3 children, operating a business selling taro and banana in her village.  She has been doing this for more than a year to earn a living. 

Maota has requested a loan to buy taro roots, banana tube, wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves to assist the business.  She will expand her business in the future using her profit.  Maota became a member of South Pacific Business Development group in 2014.

loans.use: to buy taro roots, banana tube, wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Cayetano  está en su ciclo 4 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación donde 
una de las integrantes es la Sra. Juana, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, lo que quiere decir que ha ido mejorando con su esfuerzo y trabajo.
Ella se dedica a la venta de insumos de primera necesidad, y por medio de este trabajo ayuda a su familia y los mantiene para poder darles una vida sin privaciones. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que se esfuerza por poder salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de frutas, verduras, panificados, leche y otros productos, para que de esa forma pueda seguir con su negocio como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
The San Cayetano Group is in its 4th cycle of the women's committee program, where each has a business and helps one another get ahead. They are using an elimination poll to determine their level of poverty and one of the associates, Juana, was graded as being a level 3 the last time, which means her efforts and work have paid off as she has shown great improvement this time around.

She sells basic provisions and through this business, she helps and supports her family providing them a life without deprivation. She is someone who is hard-working and a fighter, who makes the effort to get ahead.

She is requesting this loan to buy fruit, vegetables, breads, milk and other products, so she can continue her business as usual. She is grateful for this opportunity to continue her work.

loans.use: buy fruit, vegetables, bread, milk and other products.

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en: Makerita is a 23-year-old mother with two children, and she has a business selling pancakes, pork cakes, and buns in her village to earn a living. Makerita has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, bottle of vegetable oil, plastic bags, frying pan, and yeast to assist her in operating her business. She has been doing this for more than two years. Makerita hopes to build a small bakery store in the near future and provide for her family's needs. She became a member of SPBD 2012.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, bottle of vegetable oil, plastic bags, frying pan, and yeast

loans.name: Amon

texts.en:
Amon is 25 years old, married and has 1 child. He has had a motorcycle transportation business for 5 years. 

He will use this loan to buy another motorcycle. 

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and in future he hopes to expand his business and be successful as well as be able to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Phon is a 60-year-old woman living in Kampong Cham province. She has one child and grows rice as the main source of income. She grows cassava to earn additional income. 

This is the second cycles for Chantha with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has successfully repaid her previous loan. She will use her loan  to buy fertilizer. 

She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is married and charged with the responsibility of taking care of four children (two attend school).

He deals in produce, mainly coffee, maize and beans. He supplements his income by farming. He hopes to grow his business and educate his children.

He will use the loan facility to buy more coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy more coffee to sell

loans.name: Kin's Group

texts.en:
Kin is a 60-year-old man with nine children from Kampong Speu province.

He grows rice to support his family and earns 20,000 KHR per day. This is his first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He leads a group of four members to get new loan. He will spend his entire loan portion to build a decent latrine. He hopes that he can improve his family’s living.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Korng Pisey District

loans.name: Sigidia Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe   SIGIDIA  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  24 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FAKOLA, une des sous-préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités à tout moment. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution et compte bien le rembourser.Mme  NAHAWA   1ère personne à gauche sur la photo compte acheter avec son prêt 2 sacs d’atiéké, 5 litres d’huile et 5 kilogrammes d’oignons. Elle vend à FAKOLA. Elle s’approvisionne à  GUEYA une ville ivoirienne frontalière avec FAKOLA . Elle vend au comptant et parfois à crédit à une clientèle mixte.Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000FCFA.Ce bénéfice va la permettre de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the SIGIDIA group are married women who average 24 years of age and three children. They are all part of polygamous families living in FAKOLA, a sub-prefecture of the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They partnered with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to sustain their activities on an ongoing basis. They are entering their second credit cycle with the MFI, and they intend to repay their loan in full. 

Mrs. NAHAWA is the member seen at the far left in the group photo. She plans to use her loan to buy 2 sacks of atiéké, 5 litres of oil, and 5 kilos of onions. She buys her stock in GUEYA, a city of Ivory Coast and border town with Fakola. She sells cash or credit to a mixed clientele in Fakola. 

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 40,000FCFA, which will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Bombole

texts.en:
Bombole is a married woman with six children  who attend school. Her house does not have electricity or running water. 

She has operated a door-to-door clothing business for 4 years, selling  to her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

She will use the loan to purchase a bale of  clothes to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of  clothes to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is from Liloy and makes a living through her farming activities. For this crop season, she has applied for a loan from PMPC to pay for seedbed and land preparation. Josephine hopes to double her income and would love to expand her agricultural activities by buying another rice field to cultivate.

loans.use: to pay for seedbed and land preparation

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha is a 37-year-old man with two children living in Battambang province.  He  earns an income to support his family through a  junk selling and motor repair business. 

For Chantha, this is his second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and he has fully repaid his previous loan. He will the loan  to buy junk items for resale. He hopes that he can earn more income to improve his family’s living.

loans.use: to buy junk items.

loans.name: Phy's Group

texts.en:
Phy’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh city in Cambodia. Phy makes a living growing rice and earns additional money  as a tailor. 

Her village does not have reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

Her village does not have reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family

Having a water filter at home will help each of them to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

Sokhan’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh city in Cambodia. Sokhan makes a living growing rice and earns additional income as a tailor.

Her village has no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Phal's Group

texts.en:
Phal’s group lives in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Phal makes a living growing rice and works as a tailor. 

Her village does not have reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each group member to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Ra's Group

texts.en:
Ra’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Ra makes a living cultivating rice; she also does extra work both as a seller and as a construction worker to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  The group has therefore requested this loan to purchase home water filters to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Asu

texts.en: Asu is a 45-year-old mother with 8 children. She has a business selling pancakes, pork cakes, and buns in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 2 years. Asu has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, a bottle of vegetable oil, plastic bags, a fry pan, and yeast to assist her work in the business. She hopes to build a small bakery in the near future and provide for her family's needs. She became a member of South Pacific Business Development in 2012.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, a bottle of vegetable oil, plastic bags, a fry pan, and yeast.

loans.name: Paula

texts.en: Paula is a 24-year-old mother who has one child and operates a small business, selling pancakes, buns and pork cakes in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Paula has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, a fry pan, a wooden spoon, a bottle of vegetable oil and plastic bags to assist her in running the business. She hopes to use her profit to build a small bakery store in the near future and provide for her family’s needs. Paula became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, a fry pan, a wooden spoon, a bottle of vegetable oil and plastic bags.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama  Kuña Guapa, está formado por 21 integrantes, están  en el 7° ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres .Se encuentran mejorando su situación de pobreza por medio del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien en la encuesta que se le practicó esta en el nivel 3, lo que quiere decir que ha crecido y mejorado mucho, todo esto a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo  constante y por medio de la venta de comidas que ella hace y que luego sale a vender. 
La Sra. Maria pide este préstamo para la compra de verduras, condimentos, y demás, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder crecer y mejorar.
texts.en:
The group Kuña Guapa comprises 21 associates in their 7th cycle of the women's committee program. They are improving their financial situation by way of the elimination of poverty program.

One of the associates, Maria, who was polled in the program, finds herself in level 3, which means she has grown and improved, all of this through continuous effort and work and through the sale of prepared foods that she makes and then goes out to sell.

Maria is requesting this loan to buy vegetables, condiments and more, so she can continue with her business, as usual. She is grateful for the opportunity she's receiving to grow and improve.

loans.use: buy vegetables, condiments and more.

loans.name: Lonetona

texts.en: Lonetona is a 66-year-old mother with three children. She operates a small business selling vegetables in stores to earn a living. Lonetona has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, and a water tank to assist her in running the business. She has been doing this for more than two years. Lonetona will use her income to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, and a water tank

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita has bravely raised her six children alone. She has a store in Liloy that sufficiently provides for her family. She has availed herself of a loan from the Cooperative to restock the store with basic commodities. She deeply wishes to sustain her business and would love to see all her children established with their own careers.

loans.use: to restock the store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
Kuña Kyrey se llama este grupo, está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan para salir adelante. Todas buscan mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
La Sra. Catalina, miembro de este grupo, es la presidenta, quien comenta que siempre motiva a sus compañeras a poder seguir trabajando y esforzándose cada día más. Ella se dedica a la venta de asaditos, tiene muy buena clientela formada que siempre compra de ella las comidas que hace. Pide este préstamo para  la compra de ingredientes para sus asaditos, como ser carnes, palitos para asaditos, y condimentos, para preparar y vender para obtener más ingresos para la casa; comenta que por medio de la ayuda de las integrantes de su grupo ha ido creciendo bastante.
texts.en:
The group Kuña Kyrey is in its 3rd cycle of the women's committee program, in which they all work and help each other get ahead. They are all looking to improve their quality of life and that of their families.

Catalina, member of this group, is the president. She mentions that she always motivates her companions to continue working and making more of an effort every day. She sells barbecued meat. She has built up a customer base, who always buys the food she makes. She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients, like meat, wooden meat skewers and condiments to prepare and sell her barbecued meat in order to increase her household income. She comments that with the help of her companions in the group, she has grown quite a bit.

loans.use: buy meat, wooden skewers for barbecuing, and condiments.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites works hard to support her family. Marites is married and has a dried fish-making business in the Philippines.
Marites requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to make dried fish.
Marites has been in this business for one year now.
In the future, Marites would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica works hard to support her family. She is married and has a dried fish-making business in the Philippines.
She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to make dried fish.
Angelica has been in this business for 22 years now.
In the future, Angelica would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more different fish to make dried fish.

Teresa has been in this business for 15 years now. In the future, Teresa would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more different fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a 34-year-old mother with three children. She runs and operates a small convenience store in her village to earn a living. Maria has requested for a loan to buy twisties, chicken, a sack of flour, sack of sugar, sack of rice, tinned fish, vegetable oil, box of milk, sausage and plastic bags, to assist her to run the business. She has been doing this for more than two years. Maria became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy twisties, chicken, a sack of flour, sack of sugar, sack of rice, tinned fish, vegetable oil, box of milk, sausage and plastic bags.

loans.name: Nak's Group

texts.en:
The members of Nak’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Nak makes a living cultivating rice and doing extra work as a farmer to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each group member safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Djagne Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djagnè est composé équitablement de 3 femmes monogames et 3 polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 37ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djélibougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako  et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, laitues et concombres, arachides, poissons fumés et oignons. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4èmecycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Adiaratou  (femme arrêtée en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des laitues et concombres. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 7 corbeilles de laitues et 6 corbeilles de concombres en gros à Médine. La revente se fait en détails  à Djélibougou à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Adiaratou  espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Djagnè group consists of six women, three of them monogamous and the other three belonging to polygamous households. They average 37 years of age and six children each, and they all live in Djélibougou, a district of Bamako. They became acquainted as neighbors. The group members practice small trade activities. They sell lettuce and cucumbers, groundnuts, smoked fish and onions. They joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to bolster their capital, and this is their 4th group loan cycle. 

Mrs. Adiaratou (the member standing 2nd from the right in the group photo) has a great reputation as a reseller of lettuce and cucumbers. She plans to use her loan to buy 7 baskets of lettuce and 6 baskets of cucumbers from wholesalers in Médine. She retails her stock in Djélibougou to a clientele that consists mainly of women. 

With this loan, Mrs. Adiaratou expects to earn an average monthly profit of 150,000 FCFA, which she will use to reinvest in her activity. 

With the help of Soro Yiriwaso, her long-term goal is to purchase some land to live on.

loans.use: to buy lettuce and cucumbers.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each group member safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business making dried fish in the Philippines. Flordeliza has been in this business for 11 years now.

She has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to make dried fish. In the future, Flordeliza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth works hard to support her family. Lilibeth is married and has a business, making dried fish in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more fish to make dried fish.

Lilibeth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Tai

texts.en:
Tai, 36 years old, is a lovely mother of six single children. She lives in a small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, primarily growing rice, and sells the crops to local dealers. On average, she is able to make an income of 2.00 USD per day. 

Tai is living in an old house and she wants to build a comfortable one for her family. Due to the shortage in her budget, she is now applying for a Kiva loan through HKL to buy construction supplies such as brick, cement, iron, stone, timber, and sand to build a new house. Through this loan, she hopes she can experience living in a comfortable house. 

She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies such as brick, cement, iron, stone, timber, and sand to build a new house.

loans.name: Sosefina

texts.en: Sosefina is 22 years old with one child. She runs a business selling taro and bananas in her village. She has been doing this for more than a year to earn a living. Sosefina has requested for a loan to buy taro root, banana tube, a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank, and gloves to assist the business. She will expand her business in the future using her profit. She became a member of SPBD 2014.

loans.use: to buy taro root, banana tube, a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank, and gloves

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 19 years old. She operates a business selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Grace has requested a loan to buy banana tube, taro root, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals to assist her in running the business. She joined SPBD in 2014, and she hopes to use her business profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube, taro root, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 24 years old and has two children. She works hard to support her family. 

Lydia has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase fish to make dried fish.

In the future, Lydia would like to build and expand her business to secure her family’s financial future.

loans.use: to purchase fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora works hard to support her family. Nora is married and has a dried fish-making business in the Philippines.
She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase bamboo and pay for laborers' salaries to make a bamboo mat.
Nora has been in this business for ten years now.
She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo and pay for laborers' salaries to make a bamboo mat

loans.name: Soraida

texts.en:
Soraida is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Soraida is 50 years old and has one child who is in school.
She has a dried fish-making business in the Philippines. Soraida requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish to make dried fish.
Soraida has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Soraida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Pasia

texts.en:
Pasia is a 41-year-old mother who has one child and a business, selling pancakes, pork cakes and buns in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 2 years.

Pasia has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, a bottle of vegetable oil, plastic bags, a fry pan and yeast to assist her in operating the business. Pasia hopes to build a small bakery store in the near future and provide for her family needs. She became a member of SPBD 2012.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, a bottle of vegetable oil, plastic bags, a fry pan and yeast.

loans.name: Nuru Group

texts.en:
Robert, who is in his mid 30s, is single with two children; one of them is in school and the other one is still small.  He has been running a barber shop since 2007.  He works from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Robert's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy salon products and has paid back his loans successfully.  He is happy with the loans. He used the profits to pay school fees and cover his household expenses. He will use this loan to buy up-to-date salon products to meet his customers' demands. He dreams of building his own house.

Robert will share this loan with his loan group "Nuru," which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date salon products

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
La señora Leticia vive con su esposo e hijos en el barrio de Santa Cruz, al sur de Honduras, su negocio es la venta de tortillas, el cual le genera la mayor parte de sus ingresos gracias a su buena ubicación de su negocio.

Doña Leticia necesita el préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña y cal para seguir elaborando su producto y poder obtener las ganancias necesarias para salir adelante en su negocio y poder darles a sus hijos una mejorar calidad de vida.

Doña Leticia está segura que con el apoyo del crédito va a poder mejorar sus vidas, uno de sus sueños es poder mejorar su negocio y poder tener otro puesto de tortillas en otro lugar estratégico para la venta y lograr darles a sus hijos una buena educación.



Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras – Diciembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Leticia lives with her husband and their children in the neighborhood of Santa Cruz, in the south of Honduras. She engages in selling tortillas, and she earns the majority of her income from this activity thanks to the good location of her shop.

Leticia needs a loan to buy corn, firewood and lime in order to keep on preparing her products, thus earning the income she needs to get ahead with her activity, and to grant her children a better standard of living.

Leticia is sure that thanks to the loan she will succeed in improving her life and that of her family. One of her dreams is to improve her activity and to set up another tortilla shop in another strategic commercial area; she also wants to succeeds in giving her children a good education.

Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras – December 2014.

loans.use: To buy corn, firewood and lime.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Violeta has been in this business for 12 years now.

Violeta requested a 4000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Lesby Andrea

texts.es:
Lesby tiene 25 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con sus hijos en casa de sus padres en una comunidad pequeña en la zona rural del ditrito de Pucalá, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Las actividades económicas principales que se desarrollan en este distrito son la agricultura, ganadería y comercio

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con más de 2 años de experiencia en el negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. El presente crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos como arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, entre otros para aumentar el stock de su tienda, con esto Lesby espera hacer crecer más su negocio ofreciendo a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos lo que le generará un incremento en sus ingresos y mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Lesby is 25 years old and a single mother. She lives with her children in her parents' home located in a small, rural community of Pucará, a district of the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. The main economic activities in the district are agriculture, ranching and commerce.

She works selling groceries such as rice, sugar, oil, pasta, and others. Her business is located in her home. She has over two years of experience, and steady clients from whom she gets very good work and personal references.

This loan is to buy a greater quantity of groceries to increase her stock at hand. She's looking to make her business grow by offering her clients a bigger variety of products, which will increase her income and improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of groceries such as rice, sugar, pasta, oil and others, in order to increase her store's stock.

loans.name: Ana Marisol

texts.es:
Ana, ha utilizado los préstamos para fortalecer la venta de antojitos y mantener un negocio muy competitivo, su estilo de vida está cambiando favorablemente.
Nuevamente requiere de un préstamo para invertirlo en papas, yuca, plátanos, aceite, gas propano, etc. tendrá materia prima para elaborar pasteles, enchiladas, tostadas y otros. Manifiesta que su cartera de clientes esta creciendo.
texts.en:
Ana has used her previous loans to strengthen her snack sales and maintain a very competitive business; her lifestyle is changing favorably.

She is requesting a new loan to invest in potatoes, yuca, plantain, oil, propane, etc., which are the main ingredients in pastries, enchiladas, tostadas and other. She tells us that her client base is growing.

loans.use: invest in potatoes, yuca, plantain, oil, and propane, etc., which are the main ingredients in pastries, enchiladas, tostadas and others.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina, age 45, runs a general store business to earn her living. She has operated her business for 25 years. She has five children and works very hard to provide for them.

She has requested a PhP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy grocery items such as eggs and canned goods to sell in her store.

In the future, Gina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as eggs and canned goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen, age 28, raises pigs to earn a living. She has been in this business for seven years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She and her husband have four children, three of whom are enrolled in school.

Aileen requested a PhP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Aileen would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sokhchea's Group

texts.en:
Sokhchea’s group members live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sokhchea makes a living cultivating rice and working as a construction worker to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each member of the group to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family

loans.name: Hor's Group

texts.en:
Hor’s and her fellow borrower live in a rural village in Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. To support her family, Hor makes a living cultivating rice. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe and clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women safeguard the health of their families. It will also help them save money on medical expenses and save time otherwise spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family

loans.name: Sreimao

texts.en:
Living in a rural area in Siem Reap province, Sreimao is 22 years old and a mother of two children. To support her family, she earns income via rice cropping and cassava growing, earning about 30,000 KHR per day. 

Sreimao is requesting her first loan from Kiva partner VisionFund to pay for fertilizer, seed and labor costs. She hopes that she can improve her family's living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer, seed and labor costs.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Anderson

texts.es:
El señor Anderson es un hombre muy emprendedor y creativo, desde hace mucho tiempo ha querido ser independiente y tener su propio negocio de taller y cerrajería

Actualmente puede materializar su sueño gracias su gran capacidad de trabajo, al apoyo que recibe de la Corporación Interactuar y de las personas que deseen que él salga adelante con su negocio.

De este negocio dependerán su esposa y su hijo a los cuales desea enseñarles del negocio y dejarles un legado para que salgan adelante.

Solicita un apoyo económico para comprar un compresor, herramienta de mano y equipo de soldadura.

Con un préstamo podrás a poyar a un hombre lleno de vida y empuje para su familia!
texts.en:
Sr. Anderson is an enterprising and creative man. For the longest time, he has wanted to be independent and have his own workshop and metal business.
