At the moment, he is able to fulfill his dream thanks to his capacity to work. With the support he is receiving from Interactuar and people who want to help him, Anderson will be able to move forward with his business.

His wife and child depend on this business. Anderson will be able to teach his trade to his son and leave him a legacy that will help him get ahead. He is requesting a loan in order to buy a compressor, hand tools, and welding equipment.

Through this loan, you will be able to support a man who is full of life and help to propel his family!

loans.use: to buy a compressor, hand tools, and welding equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy ingredients, like meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies such as fertilizers, pesticides, fungicides, herbicides, and insecticides.

loans.name: Maryamu

texts.en: Maryamu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Maryamu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Hassan, Alheri and Tafita.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Maryamu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to her immediate needs for cash such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Maryamu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Maryamu spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fishing gear, a canoe, fishing netting, containers, an ice bag, and a torch

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora María vive en una comunidad al norte de Honduras junto con su esposo, tiene su propia sala de belleza y brinda sus servicios de belleza en general.

Doña María necesita el crédito para poder surtir su sala de belleza quiere comprar cremas de peinar, cepillos, secadoras, glases, etc. y poder brindar más variedad y dar mejor servicio a su clientela.

Doña María espera que por la época navideña su clientela sea más numerosa y que esta inversión le genere las ganancias necesarias para salir adelante con su familia.
En el futuro piensa surtir más su sala de belleza y establecer un lugar agradable y poder ofrecer todo lo referente al negocio.



Yojoa, Honduras – Diciembre del 2014.
texts.en:
María lives together with her husband in a community in the north of Honduras. She has her own beauty salon and she provides general beauty services. María needs this loan to be able to supply her beauty salon. She wants to buy combing creams, brushes, blow dryers, glass jars, etc. She will be able to offer more variety and to give better services to her customers.  María hopes that during the Christmas season her customers will be more numerous and that this investment will generate the earnings she needs to succeed with her family. In the future she is considering supplying her beauty salon more and establishing an agreeable location where she can offer everything relevant to the business. 

Yojoa, Honduras – December, 2014.

loans.use: to purchase combs, brushes, dryers, glass jars, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Majalia

texts.en:
Majalia is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Majalia is 35 years old and five of her children are in school.

Majalia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 6000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Majalia has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 38 years old and married with three children. All of her children are in school, and Estela works very hard to provide for them.

Estela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

Estela has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Estela would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Ines Anibal

texts.es:
Inés, se dedica a cultivar maíz y frijol, de esta manera provee a su familia de alimento y puede vender otra parte, también ofrece sus servicios de albañil; está acompañado, vive con su pareja y seis hijos, es una persona que lucha y se esfuerza por salir adelante con su familia, desde que tenía 12 años de edad aprendió a realizar trabajos de agricultura con ayuda de su papá, el oficio de albañil lo aprendió con un amigo, trabaja en un horario de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde. 
Invertirá en pagar mozos para recolectar la cosecha, su debido transporte, la destusada y aporreada, así agilizara sus trabajos y preparará todo para la próxima siembra de granos básicos, espera tener mayor productividad y mejorar sus ganancias.
Sus sueños son ampliar el área de cultivo, usar semilla de calidad, cancelar sus deudas y dar a su familia mejor alimentación, vestuario y salud.
texts.en:
Inés earns his living growing corn and beans. This is how he provides food for his family; he is able to sell the rest. He also provides construction services.

He is married and lives with his spouse and six children. He is a person who strives and puts great effort into getting ahead with his family. With his father's help, he learned to do agricultural work starting when he was 12 years old. He learned the construction trade with a friend. He works a schedule of eight o'clock in the morning to five o'clock in the afternoon.

He will invest in paying people to bring in the harvest and to transport it, along with husking and shelling. This way, he will accelerate his work and prepare everything for the next planting of staple grains. He hopes to have greater productivity and to improve his earnings.

His dreams are to expand his planting area, to use quality seed, to pay off his debts, and to provide his family with better food, clothing, and health.

loans.use: to invest in paying people to bring in the harvest and to transport it, along with husking and shelling. This way, he will accelerate his work and prepare everything for the next planting.

loans.name: Cepriana

texts.en:
Cepriana, age 59, raises pigs to earn an income. She has been in this business for a year now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She and her husband have four children, one of whom attends school.

Cepriana requested a PhP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Cepriana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Geoconda Esperanza

texts.es: Geoconda es una joven tranquila de 19 años de edad, vive con sus padres y con sus hermanos, junto a su madre atiende a su negocio que es una tercena, va a invertir el credito en la compra de toretes y vaconas para faenarlos y venderlos en su tercena, con este c4edito espera mejorar su negocio y sus ingresos para asistir a la universidad que es su sueño mas grande.
texts.en:
Geoconda is a quiet young woman who is 19 years of age. She lives with her parents and siblings.

Geoconda and her mother manage a butcher shop, so she will invest this loan in the purchase of bulls and cows that they can butcher and sell in their business. With this loan, she expects to improve her business and earnings since attending the university is her greatest wish.

loans.use: to buy cattle for butchering.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María una mujer del campo, orgullosa, trabajadora y que a pesar de vivir en la ciudad hizo lo posible por asemejar su entorno y sus actividades a su hogar.
María no tiene hijos y pasa por una difícil situación económica pues su esposo falleció hace algún tiempo y ahora solo depende de su venta de pollos y alimentos para sobrevivir.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de pollos y cuido para alimentarlos es en verdad una urgencia y ahora tu puedes ayudarla apoyan su forma de vivir, con su negocio de campo en la ciudad.
texts.en:
María, a country girl, who is proud and hard-working, and despite living in the city, was able to make her surroundings and business resemble home.

María has no children and went through a hard time economically when her husband died some time ago. She depends on the sale of her chickens and groceries to survive.

She is requesting a loan to buy chickens and chicken feed. She needs urgent help and now you can help her by supporting her way of life with her country business in the city.

loans.use: buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Emmanuel joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Sumanu, Usaini and Gambo.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Emmanuel would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Emmanuel can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Emmanuel spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to pay for child school fees and uniforms.

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en: Rahila is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Rahila joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Joseph and Victor.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Rahila would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cover her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rahila can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Rahila spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for child school fees and uniforms.

loans.name: Sukufa

texts.en:
Sukufa is a 40-year-old married woman with 4 children. Her children are young. Her husband is a worker in the bazaar: he sells vegetables and fruits.

Shukufa has a fruit garden. She has been growing fruits and vegetables for 15 years. Her monthly income is 150 AZN. Shukufa provides for her family with this business. Every week her husband sells these crops in the local bazaar. But now lack of water make it a problem to grow fruit. The trees are getting dry without water.

Shukufa wants to make water channels. This will help her family's standard of living.
She applied for a 1,000 AZN loan from Kiva.

loans.use: make water channels for her fruit trees.

loans.name: Tavai

texts.en: Tavai is a 29-year-old mother with one child. She owns and operates a small business of bingo in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Tavai has requested a loan to buy a bingo machine, a box of paper bingo, and a box of ink bottles to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business. Tavai became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a bingo machine, a box of paper bingo, and a box of ink bottles

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla, age 31, earns an income as a garment worker. She lives with her husband and their child in the province of Kampong Chhnang. She has been a garment worker since 2009. Her husband operates a motorcycle taxi service, using a motorcycle with a trailer. Their child attends school. Between the two of them, Phalla and her husband can earn USD 15 per day. 

Phalla would like to request a loan in order to buy a motorcycle with which to commute to work. This will provide her with better traveling conditions than she currently has. 

In the future, her plans are to buy a Korean truck for her husband to offer for rent, build fences around her house, and help her child to earn a high school diploma.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle with which to commute to work

loans.name: Sewa Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Sewa sont mariées uniquement dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 37ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Djélibougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako; Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu à Djélibougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, bananes plantains, oignons et pommes de terre. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4èmecycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata (femme  arrêtée à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente de bananes plantains ; Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 corbeilles de bananes plantains en gros à Médine; La revente se fait à Djélibougou à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Fatoumata espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The four members of the Sewa group are married women all living in polygamous households.On the average, they are 37 years old, with six children. They all live in the Djelibougou neighorhood in Bamkao. They know each other as neighbors as well as through their work. The group members work as vendors selling bananas, plantains, onions and potatoes. With the goal of replenish their stock for cash, the group members have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their fourth solidarty loan cycle.

Mrs. Fatoumata (the one standing on the far left in the photo) is a well-known banana vendors. SHe plans to use her loan to buy five baskets of bananas and plantains in Medien wholesale. She sells in Djelibougou, mainly to female customers. With this loan, Mrs. Fatoumata hopes to earn an average monthly revenue of 150,000 West African francs, which will be used to reinvest in her business and cover healthcare expenses for her children.

loans.use: to buy plantains.

loans.name: Nhoep

texts.en:
Nhoep, who is 56 years old, is living in the community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has three children in total, one is single and two are married. To make a living and support the family, she has been involved in the farming business since 1985, growing rice and selling her agricultural products to the local dealers and customers in market. The net profit that she can generate is 5.00 USD a day, on average.

This farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies for her farmland. To continue her farming, she is borrowing some money from Kiva to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds, and insecticides. 

She is thankful to lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds, and insecticides.

loans.name: Catalina De Jesus

texts.es:
Catalina, de 66 años de edad, está soltera, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, cursó sus estudios hasta 5° grado, ella vive junto a sus nietos. 

Catalina, se ha dedicado bastante tiempo a la venta de tortillas y tambien tiene una tienda en donde vende choco  bananos, hielo y charamusca. 

Catalina, solicita el préstamo para comprar lamina, madera, clavos y para pagar la mano de obra, con el fin de hacer reparaciones en su casa, ya que actualmente viven en un ambiente de inseguridad por tantod daños que tiene su casa.

El sueño de Catalina, es darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus nietos y que estudien y sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Catalina is 66 years old, single, and went to school up to grade five.  She lives with her grandchildren and works at doing the household chores.

Catalina has worked for much time selling tortillas and she also has a store where she sells “charamusca” (frozen juice or coconut milk in a baggie),  “choco bananos” (frozen bananas on a stick dipped in chocolate) and ice.

Catalina is asking for the loan to buy sheet metal, wood, nails and to pay for labour with the purpose of making repairs on her house since they currently live in an unsafe environment due to how much damage her house has.  

Catalina's dream is to give a better quality of life to her grandchildren and that they study and be good people.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal, wood, nails and to pay for labour

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with five children. Asha owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

Asha operates a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her business.
 
With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Chen

texts.en:
Chen, 31, is living in Batheay District, Kompong Cham Province of Cambodia. He has only one dependent child who is currently in school. To make a living, he manages and operates a farming business, primarily growing rice and sells his agricultural product to local dealers. On average, he is able to make an income of 2.00 USD a day.

In this farming season, he is lacking money to buy some farm supplies. To continue his farming, he is borrowing some money from Kiva now to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.  He is thankful to lenders for the financial support. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sodas and other products.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah  is 31 years old. She is married and together with her husband they support six children. Her husband provides additional income for the family.

Fridah runs a retail shop, a business she has done for the last 4 years, earning a monthly income of KES 28,000.

Fridah has requested for her 2nd loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 10,000 which she will use to add a stock of retail goods for resale.
 
With the anticipated profits, Fridah will be able to expand her business further.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a flourishing family.

loans.use: to add a stock of retail goods.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Her name is Monica, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Marlon, a sprayman, and she has two children. One is in high school and the other one in elementary level. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs, and to send her children to school. 

Monica operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 400 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as snacks, pasta, noodles, powdered milk and chocolate drink, cereals, and other grocery stuff. She expects a higher demand for grocery items this Christmas season. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment, and the financial help that will be given her for it will be a big help to support their daily needs and school needs of her children.

Monica dreams to have a big grocery store someday. She strives hard to give her children the best education possible, and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is 40 years old, a married woman and a mother of 4 children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she has requested for a loan of 45,000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits so she can provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 41-year-old working woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition. So she started a business of selling clothes. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and their education. 

Asia is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. Currently she needs a loan of 60,000 PKR  to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors.

loans.name: Zuhra

texts.en:
Zuhra is 43 years old and a married woman. The man shown in the photo is Zuhra’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. 

He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Zuhra has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR for her husband. 

He wants to replace the body of the rickshaw and get new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Zuhra is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to replace the rickshaw body and get new tires.

loans.name: Riaz

texts.en:
Riaz is 55 years old and is a married woman. She is running a business of milk selling with her husband. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas.  

Riaz’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. 

Therefore, Riaz  has requested for 50,000 PKR  to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers and so she can provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Houy's Group

texts.en:
Houy and her fellow borrower live in a rural village in Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. To support her family, Houy makes a living cultivating rice.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe and clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women safeguard the health of their families. It will also help them save money on medical expenses and save time otherwise spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their families

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en:
Heng and her group members live in a rural village in Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. To support her family, Heng makes a living cultivating rice.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe and clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women safeguard the health of their families. It will also help them save money on medical expenses and save time otherwise spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family

loans.name: Sim's Group

texts.en:
Sim and her group members live in a rural village in Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. Sim makes a living cultivating rice and planting watermelons. Additionally, she works as a tailor to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe and clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members safeguard the health of their families. It will also help them save money on medical expenses and save time otherwise spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family

loans.name: Ayesha

texts.en: Ayesha is a 61-year-old vigorous, married woman. She has had a business of hand embroidery for many years. She knows the art of making beautiful embroidery patterns with beads and pearls. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenses, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband does not earn enough to support his family well alone. Ayesha’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. She is a mother of four children. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins, and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand to gain more profits.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities

loans.name: Kan Thar Village Group 1

texts.en:
This community is located in Kan Thar Village, Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region. In this community, there are five CBO (Community Based Organization) members overseeing a group of 24 village customers (6 males, 18 females). This loan will help the villagers purchase ducks as well as high-quality feed (cost: $75 for three different ingredients that need to be mixed).

In Kan Thar Village, there are 307 households and a population of over 2,000, and many of them are crop farmers. As well, they plant seasonal food such as cucumbers, rosella and bananas, which they sell at towns or other villages. As there are streams nearby the houses, they do fishing, too, and export the fish to the city. For additional income, the villagers also raise hens, pigs and ducks.

Above is the picture of four CBO members and two village customers, named as Daw Thu, Daw Zar, Daw Kay, U Htin, U Nyein, and U Hla. Included in the picture, Daw Thu (third from right) is 36 years old and married with two children. Her husband farms on their 3-acre crop farm, and she sells dry food at her small shop. For livestock, she has raised 116 ducks and 10 chickens. As Daw Thu and her husband are busy at their businesses, they have hired a duck farmer, to whom they need to pay $2 per day.

Proximity's loan will enable her to pay for labor costs and purchase better-quality feed that will let them have more eggs.

loans.use: to purchase ducks as well as high-quality feed.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 58 years old and single.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Adelaida has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years, and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Adelaida aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosita is 50 years old now.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Rosita requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Rosita has been in this business for 29 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Nelson Javier

texts.es: Nelson, tiene 37 años de edad, es casado, tiene dos hijos y reside en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Tela, Atlántida.  Nelson anteriormente trabajaba en una maquila, pero hace 9 años decidió por tener su propio negocio de transporte, presta el servicio en un taxi y microbús en la aldea y sus alrededores. El préstamo que solicita es por 6,000 Lempiras, siendo el segundo ciclo con la institución. Con este préstamo va comprar repuestos para reparar su taxi y poder brindar mejor servicio a su clientela. Su sueño es continuar trabajando y mejorar cada día con su negocio.
texts.en:
Nelson is 37 years old. He is married and has two children. He lives in a town that is part of the municipality of Tela, Atlántida. 

Nelson previously worked in a garment factory, but nine years ago, he decided to have his own transportation business. He provides his services in a taxi and a microbus in the town and its surroundings. 

The loan he is requesting is for 6,000 Lempiras (HNL), and it is his second with the institution. With this loan, he is going to buy parts in order to repair his taxi and provide better service to his customers. His dream is to continue working and to improve his business every day.

loans.use: to buy parts in order to repair his taxi

loans.name: Usaini

texts.en: Usaini is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Usaini joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Emma, Ubadiya and Balki.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Usaini would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cover for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Usaini can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Usaini spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to pay for child school fees and uniforms.

loans.name: Virginita

texts.en:
Virginita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to make dried fish.

Virginita has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Virginita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Yguazu Group

texts.es:
El grupo Yguazú está en su 2do ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder conocer y mejorar su situación de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra.  Maria quien según su encuesta está en una pobreza extrema, ella tiene un copetín en el que trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano, y por medio de su negocio trata de salir adelante y tener mejores ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de golosinas, bebidas, alfajores, y demás, de manera a continuar con sus ventas y tener mejores ingresos para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The group “Yguazú” is in its second loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members are committed to working and helping one another move forward. They are also taking the poverty elimination survey so that they can become familiar with and improve their living situations.

One of the members is Sra. Maria, whose survey results indicate that she is in extreme poverty. She has a snack bar where she works every day, starting in the early morning hours. Through this business, she is trying to move forward and earn a better income so that she can help her family.

Maria is requesting a loan in order to buy snack foods, beverages, sandwich cookies, and other items so that she can continue her sales and generate more income for improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, beverages, sandwich cookies, and other items.

loans.name: Los Aliados Group

texts.es:
El banco de emprendimiento LOS ALIADOS compuesta por ocho integrantes todas son mujeres, ellas se dedican a distintas actividades como; venta de jugos batidos, venta de celulares,  venta de refrescos, venta de cosméticos, venta de comida y venta de ropa, por este motivo solicitan un préstamo para ampliar sus negocios.
La señora  Rosmery es una mujer de 26  años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos de 2 y 7 años de edad,  ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio, Su trabajo lo realiza en la localidad del Torno, un área caracterizada por el creciente comercio, donde su actividad principal de los pobladores son la agricultura, ganadería con una temperatura que varía de los 15-35 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Rosmery es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, estatura mediana, complexión física delgada (en la foto es la señora que esta parada con un blusa blanca con rosada y un corto negro), su lengua materna es el español Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en un año que lleva con esta actividad.
Por este motivo solicita el préstamo para la compra de variedad de productos para surtir su tienda, porque estas fechas de fin de año tienen mucha demanda.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Los Aliados" (The Allies) is composed of eight members who are all women. They all make a living doing different things such as selling juices, selling cell phones, selling beverages, selling cosmetics, selling food, and selling clothing. It is for this reason that they are requesting a loan to expand their businesses. 

Rosmery is a 26-year-old woman. She is married and has two children who are 2 and 7 years old. She makes a living selling basic staples in her neighborhood store. She carries out her work in the town of Torno, an area characterized by its growing commerce where the residents primarily work in agriculture and livestock with a temperature that varies between 15 and 35 degrees Celsius throughout the year.

Rosmery is dark-skinned with long, black hair. She is of average height and has a thin physique. (In the photograph she is the woman who is standing with a white and pink shirt and black shorts.) Her native tongue is Spanish. This is her first sequence of loans with the institution in the year that she has had her business. She is requesting a loan to buy a variety of products to stock her store because at the end of the year there is great demand.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products to stock her store.

loans.name: Giajelia

texts.en:
Giajelia is 45 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Giajelia has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years, and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Dioseta

texts.en:
Dioseta is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Dioseta is 57 years old, and has one child who is in school.

Dioseta has a food vending business in the Philippines. Dioseta requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients and other materials to use in her business.

Dioseta has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and other materials to use in her business

loans.name: Reina De La Paz

texts.es:
Reina, ha decidido solicitar un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en un qq de concentrado para las aves de corral y para pagar los costos de la recolección de la cosecha de maíz y frijol, esto le permitirá continuar trabajando y mejorar las condiciones económicas.
Con la ayuda del crédito anterior ha mejorado su negocio de cultivo de granos básicos y la crianza de pollos, la experiencia que ha adquirido en la administración de créditos la ha dado como resultado mejores ganancias que ha utilizado para dar a su hijo una mejor alimentación, vestuario y educación.
texts.en:
Reina has decided to request a new loan to invest in one quintal of balanced feed for the poultry and to pay the costs of bringing in the corn and bean harvests. This will allow her to continue working and improving her economic conditions. 

With the help of the previous loan, she has improved her business of farming staple grains and raising chickens. The experience that she has acquired in administering her loans has resulted in better earnings, which she has used to give her son better food, clothing, and education.

loans.use: to invest in a quintal of balanced feed for the poultry and to pay costs of bringing in the corn and bean harvest

loans.name: Dora Elena

texts.es:
Dora una adorable, humilde, responsable y trabajadora Ama de casa que gracias a su tienda donde oferta dulces, refrescos y productos de primera necesidad ha logrado suplir los ingresos que le daba su exesposo.
Es madre de dos hijos ya mayores de edad y solo cuenta con su tienda para generar dinero.
Dora vive en una zona muy afectada por la violencia, conflictos armados y constantes vacunas realizadas por grupos ilegales su mayor sueño es salir de este lugar y situarse en una zona más segura por ello solo le queda trabajar.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido entre dulces, frituras en empaques, galletas, y surtido de productos de primera necesidad.
texts.en: Dora is a hardworking, lovely, humble and responsible housewife who, thanks to her store where she offers sweets, drinks and basic necessities, has been able to supplement the earnings that her ex-husband gives to her. She is the mother of two children who are older and she only relies on her store to earn money. Dora lives in an area that is very affected by violence, armed conflict and constant shootings completed by illegal groups. Her greatest dream is to leave this place and move to an area that is more secure where all she needs to do is work. She is seeking a loan to purchase a selection of sweets, packaged fritters, cookies and a selection of basic necessities.

loans.use: to purchase a selection of sweets, packaged fritters and cookies.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es:
Manuel, de 42 años de edad, estudió hasta cuarto grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar, tienen 6 hijos, pero solo 3 hijos viven en casa.  

Manuel, es agricultor desde hace 12 años, aprendió trabajando como ayudante, ahora él siembra para vender y para su consumo, por lo general siembra 10,500 metros cuadrados cerca de su casa y además realiza trabajos de ayudante de albañil. 

El préstamo lo necesita para instalar energía eléctrica y para comprar cemento para hacer un depósito de agua en su casa. Todo esto ayudará para que su esposa no tenga que ir a otro lugar a realizar algunos oficios por falta de luz o agua.

Manuel, desea mejorar su vivienda poco a poco y espera alquilar un poco más de terreno para las próximas siembras.
texts.en:
Manuel is 42 years old and studied through the fourth grade. He is married and his wife takes care of the household duties. They have six children, but only three of them live at home.

Manuel has been a farmer for 12 years. He learned the trade by working as an assistant. Manuel now grows crops to sell and for personal consumption. He cultivates 10,500 square meters of land near his house, but he is also hired for jobs as a bricklayer’s assistant.

The loan he is requesting will be used to install electricity and to buy cement for building a water receptacle for his house. All of this will be a great help for his wife, who won’t have to obtain work outside of the home because they lack electricity or water.

Manuel wants to make improvements to his home a little bit at a time. He also wants to rent some more land for the next few planting seasons.

loans.use: to install electricity and to buy cement for building a water receptacle for his house.

loans.name: Djiguiseme Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les six (06) membres du groupe Djiguisème ont en moyenne 40 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djélibougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu à Djélibougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, bananes, oranges, poissons, laitues, carottes, bananes plantains et pommes de terre. Dans l’intention d’accroitre leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4èmecycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata (femme  arrêtée à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de bananes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4 corbeilles de bananes en gros à Médine. La revente se fait en détails à Djélibougou  en ambulant à une clientèle  de mixtes. Madame Fatoumata compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The six members of the Djiguisème group are married women who belong for the most part to monogamous households. They average 40 years of age and three children each. They all live in Djélibougou, a district of Bamako, and they know one another as neighbors and through the income-generating activities they conduct in the village. They practice small trade selling bananas, oranges, fish, lettuce, carrots, plantains and potatoes. 

To bolster their working capital, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance organization. This is their 4th group loan cycle. 

Mrs. Fatoumata (standing at the far left in the group photo) is a major reseller of bananas. She plans to use her loan to buy 4 baskets of bananas wholesale in Médine. She retails her stock as an itinerant vendor in Djélibougou to a mixed clientele.  

With this loan, Mrs. Fatoumata expects to earn an average monthly profit of 150,000FCFA, which she will use to provide for her household and to reinvest in her activities.

loans.use: to buy bananas.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 48-year-old lady married to Thomas and blessed with four children who are all adults. She has been in the farming business for the last 20 years and earns a monthly income of KES 10,800 which she uses to support her family. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 7,000 from Vision Fund Kenya and intends to use the entire loan amount to buy an energy saving jiko (cook stove) for use in her family. Esther hopes to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy an energy-saving Jiko.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is driven by a passion for selling. At the age of 53 and married, she is an industrious mother in Lopez Jaena who runs a store that primarily supports their family. Everyday she never gets tired of tending to her store.

Lorna is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without records of default. Now, she is borrowing another loan to pay for inventory of sugar, milk, oil, noodles, and soft drinks to sell. Having enough inventory would mean more income opportunities.

In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, noodles, and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan has a grocery business in Eldoret town and has been running this business for 7 years. She is 27 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 3 children. 

She will use this loan to buy more stock of vegetables, potatoes, tomatoes and fruits to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to buy a piece of land and build rental houses. 

This is her second loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she paid back her previous loan successfully. Her future hopes are to buy land, develop it and be successful.

loans.use: To buy more stock of vegetables, tomatoes and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Majani

texts.en:
Majani is a married woman with two kids, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Majani has operated a grocery and vegetable-selling stall for three years. She sells at the market to town-dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future.

With the Ksh 15,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 23 years old. She lives in Kutaisi district with her father, brother and sister. Salome works as a cashier at local bank and gets a monthly income. 

She owns a commercial space where she plans to open a small shop. Salome requested a loan. The Start-Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 550 $. With the received credit she will purchase phone accessories and will resell them in the newly-opened shop. 

Salome is very motivated to have additional income and awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a small shop to sell phone accessories.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is a 42-year-old, married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Nargis makes enough to provide for her family.

To make her store fully stocked, she requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR which she will use to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil, and flour from the market at lower rates to make stock available for her customers. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently.

Nargis wishes to utilize part of her revenues on providing a good, quality life for her family members.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil, and flour for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open a retail space and pay for supplies.

loans.name: Fajan

texts.en:
Fajan is 59 years old, and is a married woman who has been running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffaloes for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. 

Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation, now, she has requested for a loan of 50,000 PKR  to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales so as to earn good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is 38 years old, and is a married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting in the shop. 

Over time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and make enough to meet the expenses of their 6 children. 

Currently, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater for a maximum number of customers and generate a healthier source of income. She is positive about her future earnings and will spend the part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana  is 47 years old and is a married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (also shown in the photo) at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

She is a mother of 5 children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle the increasing demands of her customers efficiently. This way she will get a boost in her earnings so she will be able to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices and juices.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim  is 37 years old and is a married woman. She has 2 children. Shamim  is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hands. Her skill is known throughout the town. 

She has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, threads, frames to meet orders of her customers on time and so to earn good amount of profits. This monetary help can take Shamim closer to her dream of providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads, frames.

loans.name: Elvia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Elvia es una mujer de 65 años de edad, que supo criar a 4 hijos ya ellos mayores de edad, en el transcurso de su vida siempre se mostró como una mujer muy aguerrida que no le gustaba que le dieran nada, trabaja para ganarse su propio sustento y hasta el momento lo sigue haciendo.
Se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogo, venta de ropa interior y pijamas, dichas ventas son las que le generan los ingresos para comprar su comida, pagar sus cuentas y alguno que otro antojo que ella tiene.
Pensando es mejorar, de no ser conformista Elvia solicita un crédito para comprar promociones que le ofrecen tanto en ropa, en productos y ropa interior, la principal ventaja es que puede vender al precio de la revista pero tendrá un mejores ganancias al comprar al por mayor que es la finalidad del préstamo.
Ayuda a  Elvia a escalar en esa pirámide de revistas a tener un mejor puesto e ingresos para disfrutar su vejez tranquila
texts.en:
Elvia is a 65-year-old who was able to raise 4 grown children. In the course of her life, she has always been a very brave woman who did not like that she was not given anything so she works to earn her own living and still does. 

She sells products by catalog like underwear and pajamas. These sales generate the income to buy food, pay bills, and the occasional wants she has.

Thinking about improving but being a nonconformist, Elvia is requesting a loan to purchase clothing and underwear products at the sale prices being offered. The main advantage of this is that she can sell the products at the listed price but will have better earnings through buying wholesale. That is the purpose of the loan.

Help Elvia climb up the pyramid of catalog sales to have a better job and income to enjoy a peaceful old age.

loans.use: to purchase clothing at wholesale prices

loans.name: Veronica Judith

texts.es:
Verónica, de 26 años de edad, está acompañada, es empleada y su pareja se dedica a la pesca, tiene dos hijos; el primero tiene 6 años y el segundo tiene 4 años de edad.

Verónica, tiene 5 años de estar trabajando en una maquila, de ese trabajo ella obtiene los ingreso necesarios para el hogar. 

Verónica, solicita el préstamo para comprar de tres redes y materiales para el mantenimiento del equipo de pesca de su esposo. 

El sueño de Verónica, es colocar una puesto de compra y venta de mariscos, para asegurar sus ingresos y darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Veronica is 26 years old and she has a life partner. She's employed and her partner earns a living as a fisherman. She has two children, a 6- and a 4-year-old.

She's been working for five years at a factory in a free trade zone. This is how she gets the income for her home.

She is requesting the loan to buy three fishing nets as well as material for the maintenance of her partner's fishing gear.

Veronica's dream is to set up a stall to buy and sell seafood, so she can ensure her income and give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy three fishing nets and material for fishing gear maintenance.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 49 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Leonida runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc. She has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future, Leonida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Precil

texts.en:
Precil is 39 years old and married with nine children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins. She has been raising pigs for 2 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

Precil is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 36-year-old married woman and a mother of 5 children. 

In order to support her husband in taking care of the family she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. 

She has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales, generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is 41 years old, a married woman having four children. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has become popular in her community for providing good quality products and makes enough to meet her household expenses. 

Currently, she requested a loan of 35,000 PKR  to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea so she can cater for a maximum number of customers, increase her income and provide a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea.

loans.name: Daniel Ulises

texts.es:
Daniel, nuevamente solicita un crédito para comprar hierro en diferentes medidas y algunas herramientas para mantener su taller de estructuras metálicas con vida, su propósito es cumplir los pedidos de sus clientes y seguir mejorando la economía familiar.
El financiamiento anterior le ha dado una experiencia positiva para seguir trabajando con créditos, pudo tener materia prima suficiente para tener clientes satisfechos, estabilidad económica y oportunidad de mejorar la calidad de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Daniel is requesting another loan so that he can buy iron in different sizes and a few tools to keep his metal shop in operation. He plans to fulfill his customers’ orders and improve his family’s financial situation.

His previous loan resulted in a positive experience, so he is able to continue taking advantage of his line of credit. Daniel was able to buy enough material so that he could keep his clients satisfied. He also achieved financial stability and had the opportunity to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy iron in different sizes and a few tools to keep his metal shop in operation.

loans.name: Stefania

texts.es:
Ella es stefania una hermosa joven de tan solo 20 años de edad, madre soltera con una hermosa hija a quien se puede ver en la foto, talentosa y con excelentes proyecciones de la vida.
Al momento de tener su hija no espero que el padre o sus familiares se la mantuvieran, por el contrario esta maravillosa joven decidió iniciar su negocio de confecciones y hoy en día cuenta con tres empleados a cargo más ella.
Stefania no quiere parar no quiere conformarse quiere más y más pro ello solicita un crédito para la compra de una maquina recubridora que es un elemento que le falta en su micro-taller con ella podrá tener prendas más pulidas y aceptar un mayor número de pedidos.
Su sueño y anhelo es salir adelante no solo por ella si no por su hija
texts.en:
This is Stefania, a beautiful young single mother of a beautiful daughter who you can see in the photo. She is talented as has excellent optimism about her life. 

At the time of her daughter’s birth, she did not expect the father or his family to support them. However, this wonderful young woman decided to start her own business selling apparel and today has three employees under her charge.

Stefania will not stop. She does not want to settle. She wants more and more so she requested a loan for the purchase of an industrial sewing machine that she needs for her small workshop. She will be making more professional clothing and get more orders.

Her dream and desire is to succeed not only for herself but for her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial professional sewing machine

loans.name: Luz Nancy

texts.es:
Luz Nancy es una comerciante que cuenta con una miscelánea donde oferta variedad de productos de decoración, mujer sin hijos que se separó de su esposo y que solo cuenta con su miscelánea para generar los ingresos para su propio sustento y de algunos de sus familiares.
Ella es muy responsable, cumplida, creativa y emprendedora, solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido navideño, que son básicamente artículos de decoración la razón del monto es que son mercancías que tiene un precio elevado por ello la razón del monto. 
El crédito le permitirá tener mercancía nueva para esta temporada tan especial y celebrada por los colombianos.
Su sueño es trabajar para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en: Luz Nancy is a businesswoman who counts on a general store where she offers a variety of decorative products. She is a woman without children who separated from her husband and only counts on her store to generate earnings for her own sustenance and that of some of her family. She is very responsible, accomplished, creative and entrepreneurial. She is seeking a loan to purchase Christmas supplies that are basically items for decoration. The reason she is asking for this amount is because the goods have a high price. This loan will allow her to have new merchandise for this special season that is celebrated by Colombians. Her dream is to work to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of Christmas decorations.

loans.name: Bertha Fabiola

texts.es:
Pedro Vicente Maldonado un Cantón muy hermoso, su clima es cálido húmedo su gente es amable y trabajadora este Cantón es el punto de llegada de muchos turistas ya que a los alrededores del mismo tenemos muchas hosterías en las que se puede descansar y ser tratados con amabilidad y respeto.  
En este Cantón vive y tiene el negocio la señora Bertha una mujer luchadora de 55 años es viuda tiene 3 hijos ya todos mayores de edad todos son independientes y tienen sus propias familias, solo el último de ellos vive con ella y le ayuda en el negocio, la señora Bertha viene de familia de bajos recursos económicos y no pudo estudiar solo tiene la primaria, pero gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación, ayudó a sus hijos a prepararse y que tengan un mejor futuro.
Tienen una tienda de víveres en general y también alquiler de computadoras con internet, aprendió de esta actividad por iniciativa propia, al mismo le dedica un promedio de 15 horas diarias, solicita este crédito para invertir en el negocio, comprará mercadería de temporada, con esta inversión incrementaran sus ventas y mejoraran sus ingresos económicos, la señora Bertha agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Pedro Vicente Maldonado is a very beautiful area. The weather is warm and humid and its residents are kind and hardworking. This canton is a preferred destination for many tourists, because there are lots of inns nearby where people can rest and be treated with kindness and respect.
 
This is where Bertha lives and runs her business. She is a very driven woman. She is 55 years old, a widow, and has three children who are all adults now and have their own families. Only the youngest still lives with her and helps her run her business. Bertha comes from a low-income family and wasn't able to get an education beyond primary school, which she did complete. But with her effort and dedication she was able to send her children to school and give them a better future.

They have a grocery store and also rent computers with access to the internet. She learned the business on her own initiative. She dedicates an average of fifteen hours a day to her business. She is requesting this loan to invest in her business by purchasing seasonal merchandise. This investment will help her sales increase and her income improve. Bertha wants to thank Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for their support and this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy seasonal merchandise.

loans.name: Laumata

texts.en: Laumata is a 40-year-old woman with five children. She owns and operates a small business selling elei printing materials at the market to earn a living. Laumata has requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, elei designs, containers and a printing machine to assist her run the business. She has been doing this for more than a year. Laumata hopes to build a small elei shop in her village in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, elei designs, containers and a printing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is 40 years old. She is widowed and supports her three children of 19, 16 and 13 years respectively.

Sheila sells mandazis, a business she has done for the last four years, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 6,000.

Sheila has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of Kshs. 15,000, which she will use to buy bales of self-raising flour and cooking oil.

With the anticipated profits, Sheila will be able to expand her business further.

Her hope and dream for the future is to improve her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy bales of self-raising flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Nuti

texts.en:
Nuti is a 42-year-old lady who runs a small business selling elei print in her community. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Nuti has requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, and elei design to run the business. She will expand her business by using her profit. 

Nuti joined SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, and elei design

loans.name: Paatita

texts.en:
Paatita is a 44-year-old man. He is married to Narenik, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with seven children. Paatita has been a farmer for ten years, earning an income of KES 15,000 at the end of every month.

Paatita is now requesting his 8th loan, in the amount of KES 80,000, with VisionFund Kenya. He intends to use the loan to buy additional livestock to sell to his customers.  

Paatita plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for his children, and he hopes to have a bright future with a successful life.

loans.use: To buy additional livestock to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Andres

texts.en: Andres makes a good living every quarter from his coconut farm in Lao Sta Cruz, Plaridel in the Philippines. This is his means of supporting his family. Andres has been able to send all his children to school until they graduated and secured their own jobs. Out of the money he has saved, Andres purchased a two-hectare plot. Now, he wishes to plant more dwarf coconuts of a good variety so he can increase his farm's yield. However, Andres is in need of working capital. He presented his project to Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and has requested a loan of 45,000 PHP in order to pay for the labor to clear and plow his land and plant seedlings. Andres has high hopes that his farm will have a good, high-quality yield.

loans.use: to pay for the labor costs to clear and plow land and plant seedlings on his coconut farm

location.town: Plaridel-Lao Sta. Cruz, Plaridel, Misamis Occident

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 42 years old, married, and has six children, two of whom attend school.  She is in the agricultural business, raising goats in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years. 

Elizabeth requested her fifth loan from NWTF for 11,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional feed and vitamins for her goats. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her goats

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 56 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Julie has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Musa who is a 40-year-old smallholder farmer from Kapsowar area in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. Musa owns a 2-acre farm. On the farm, he practices mixed farming. The kind father keeps dairy animals and grows varieties of crops and vegetables. He has 10 years of experience in farming. 

Musa is seeking a loan to expand his horticulture farm. He is very hardworking and determined to increase his farm's output. Loans for smallholder farmers with little irregular income and no solid collateral are hard to come by in Kenya. Few organizations such as Juhudi Kilimo support farmers like Musa. 

Through a group of 10 members called S.S.G self-help group, Musa has access to income-generating asset loans from Juhudi, which use the group-based savings as collateral. According to Juhudi Kilimo, horticulture represents an opportunity for reducing poverty through income generation among smallholders, whether unskilled or semi-skilled. Juhudi Kilimo facilitates loans that empower smallholder farmers like Musa because the institution believes that smallholder farmers too are actively involved in various segments of the horticultural industry.

loans.use: To expand his horticulture farm.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 51 years old and has two children who are in school.

Lydia has a buy-and-sell homemade candies business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lydia has been in this business for three years. In the future, Lydia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Silva

texts.en: Silva operates a bar in Hoima, Uganda, mainly selling beer and sodas. He supplements his income by farming, and desires to grow and expand his business. Silva will use this loan to buy more beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy more beer to sell.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a 34-year-old married woman. She has been involved in agriculture work with the help of her husband for the past two years. She deals in cropping and also looks after cattle. Being a mother of four children, she is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health and clothing.

She wants to improve her business; however, due to the lack of availability of funds she is unable to do so. She is currently in her fourth loan cycle and has borrowed 45,000 PKR from Kashf to purchase one more buffalo.

This will help her to expand her business, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Edwin Yohany

texts.es:
Edwin es un sorprendente Joven de 20 años de edad, que logro montar un negocio de venta de insumos para la confección como lo son los hilos, nylon y algunas maquinarias, materiales usados en cualquier confección.
La historia es que este jove3n con su ánimo de salir adelante y de estudiar busco como generar un ingreso y míralo ya tiene su propio almacén.
Edwin solicita un crédito para la compra de Hilos de algunos colores que en el momento no cuenta, surtido de Nylon y maquinaria, tu apoye puede hacer que este joven siga creciendo y pagando su propio estudio, pues viene de familia pobre y sueña con ser adinerado sin perder la humildad que siempre lo caracteriza.
Tu apoyo puede lograr que este joven pueda terminar sus estudios, anímate Edwin te necesita
texts.en: Edwin is a surprising 20 year old young man who has completed the establishment of a business selling supplies for sewing such as threads, Nylon, and a few machines and materials used for any clothing. The story behind this is that this young man, with his zeal for success and to study, searched for a way to generate earnings and look at him now, he has his own store. Edwin is seeking a loan to purchase certain colors of thread that he does not have at this moment, a supply of Nylon and machines. Your support can permit this young man to continue growing and pay for his studies because he comes from a poor family and he dreams of becoming wealthy without losing his characteristic humility. Your help can help this young man complete his studies. Go for it, Edwin needs you.

loans.use: to purchase certain colors of thread that he does not have at this moment.

loans.name: Tern's Group

texts.en: The members of Tern’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Tern makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor and factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Sea's Group

texts.en: The members of Sea’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sea makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with five kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Asha operates a stall selling groceries and vegetables. She has done this for a month. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: Johana Marcela

texts.es:
Johana es una madre soltera de 31 años de edad, tiene dos hijos de 6 y 10 años y logra mantenerlos y llevarles el sustento gracias a una tienda donde oferta productos de la canasta familiar y bebidas, su mayor necesidad pasa en que es sola y todos los gastos van por su cuenta y en ocasiones no le queda para abastecer su negocio, por ello necesita de urgencia un crédito el cual invertirá en la compra de; granos, víveres, cerveza, refrescos y productos de aseo.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá tener el surtido suficiente para satisfacer sus clientes y proyectar su tienda hacia un progreso buscando en un futuro montar un mini-mercado
texts.en:
Johana, 31, is a single mother of two children aged 6 and 10 years old. She manages to care for them and bring sustenance to their home through her shop where she sells basic grocery products and beverages. Her greatest need is that currently all of her income goes to pay for necessities because she is single. She cannot supply money for her business so she needs an urgent loan with which she can buy basic staple products, food, beer, soft drinks, and toiletries. 

With the help of the loan she can have enough variety to satisfy her customers. She looks forward to making progress with her store in the future and establishing her own mini-market.

loans.use: to stock her store with groceries and beverages

loans.name: Savun

texts.en: A mother of five children who lives in Prey Veng province, Savun is 30 years old. She earns a living by growing rice and working for others for a fee to earn extra income. This is her first time requesting a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Savun will use the loan to pay tuition fees for her daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree in nursing. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees for her daughter

location.town: Prey Veng province, Bar Phnom district

loans.name: Khmao

texts.en: Khmao is 19 years old, a married factory worker with a small child (with her in the photo) living in Takeo province in Cambodia. She has worked as a worker since 2013. Her husband is a 23-year-old construction worker. Both of them can make approximately USD 11 a day. Due to the fact that Khmao goes to work far from home, she has decided to apply for a loan to buy a motorcycle to commute to work. With the loan, she will be able to reduce traveling expenses and have better traveling conditions. For her future plans, she is going to save money to build a new house and help her child to earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to commute to work

loans.name: Latapu

texts.en: Latapu is a 40-year-old woman with one child. She operates a small business selling elei printing materials at the market to earn a living. Latapu has requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, elei designs, containers and a printing machine to assist her run the business. She has been doing this for more than a year. Latapu hopes to build a small elei shop in her village in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, elei designs, containers and a printing machine.

loans.name: Niutolo

texts.en:
Niutolo is 42 years old and has a business selling pancakes, pork cake, and buns in her village to earn a living. Niutolo has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, a bottle of vegetable oil, plastic bags, a frying pan, and yeast, to assist her to operate the business. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Niutolo hopes to build a small bakery store in the near future and provide for her family needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, a bottle of vegetable oil, plastic bags, a frying pan, and yeast

loans.name: Tau

texts.en: Tau is 21 years old. She runs a small business selling pancakes, buns and pork cakes in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than four years. Tau has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, fry pan, wooden spoon, bottle of vegetable oil and plastic bags to assist her in running the business. She hopes to use her profit to build a small bakery store in the near future and provide for family needs. Tau became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, fry pan, wooden spoon, bottle of vegetable oil and plastic bags

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi is a 35-year-old  married mother of five children, three of whom are in school. A very hardworking entrepreneur, for the past five years she has operated a business buying and selling water in the Philippines. 

Noemi has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more drinking water for her enterprise. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy drinking water for her business

loans.name: Renee

texts.en:
Renee is 49 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by selling trees in the Philippines. Renee is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase tree seedlings, fertilizers, etc.

Renee has been selling trees for one year.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase tree seedlings, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Susan works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Susan is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Artely

texts.en:
