Artely is 54 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, etc.

Artely has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Dolis Del Carmen

texts.es:
Dolis es una mujer de 39 años de edad, que se dedica la venta de porcinos y aves, una actividad que inicio por necesidad económica pues su esposo no conseguir los recursos suficientes para alimentar a su número familia que la conforman la sorprendente cifra de 9 hijos 6 de ellos menores de edad, por eso debe tener un buen negocio con el que pueda suplir todas las necesidades y gastos que demanda su número familia.
Para poder mantener una familia tan grande, Dolis quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de cerdos y aves, los cuales engordara pro un periodo de tiempo para posteriormente vender y sacar un buen beneficio lucrativo.
texts.en: Dolis is a 39 year old woman who's employed selling pigs and poultry, a job that she started because of financial need since her husband wasn't able to make enough to feed their large family, which consists of a surprising 9 children, 6 of whom are minors. That's why she must have a good business to cover all of the needs and expenses of her large family. To be able to support such a large family Dolis wants to request a loan to purchase pigs and poultry, which she will fatten for a period of time and subsequently sell for a good profit.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and poultry.

loans.name: Luis Octabio

texts.es:
Él es Octavio un sonriente, amigable, cariñoso amigo de todos, un personaje típico del barrio que todos le tienen cariño, es un hombre soltero que vela por el cuidado de sus tres hijas y de su niña consentida que es su tienda dónde oferta productos de la canasta familiar, como granos, víveres, frutas, verduras etc., él tiene una responsabilidad con sus vecinos la cual es tener su tienda con suficiente surtido y retribuirles ese cariño y esa fidelidad que tienen con él.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido tanto en granos, productos refrigerados como leche, quesito, arepas, dulces, galletas, frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
He is Octabio, a smiling, charming, loving friend to everyone, a typical person from the barrio who everyone loves. He is a single man who takes care of his three daughters as well as his "spoiled child," which is his store where he sells products from the family basket, such as grains, groceries, fruit, vegetables, etc.

Octabio has a responsibility for his neighbors which is to keep his store stocked with an adequate selection of goods and to recompense them for this love and loyalty that they have for him. 

Octabio is requesting a loan to purchase a selection of grains and refrigerated products like milk and small cheeses, plus cornmeal cakes, sweets, cookies, fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: buy inventory, including grains and refrigerated products like milk, small cheeses, and cornmeal cakes, sweets, cookies, fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Clementina

texts.en:
Clementina is a widow with four children. They live in a two-room house in Bamenda in the North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced some problems in life, ranging from no concern shown by family members after the death of her husband, ill health and poor sales. This has hindered her a lot. 

The new loan she is going in for is to buy items like rice, beans, corn, milk, coco yam and Irish potatoes, as well as material for sewing and firewood to sell. Clementina is optimistic that she will succeed because she has run the business for quite some time, and the demand for firewood is high. 

The community will benefit from this activity in that the people will have ready access to food items and wood at cheaper prices. The profit from this loan will be used to increase the size of the business, to buy a sewing machine, to raise the standards of the family's well being and provide for the children's school fees. 

Clementina prefers a loan from Ghape because they give out money with very low interest rates and they teach you how to manage your capital in business for success. They also benefit from the ideas exchanged through their weekly and monthly meetings, not leaving out the fact that they do follow ups for proper utilization.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, corn, milk, coco yam and Irish potatoes, as well as material for sewing and firewood to sell.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick, 40 years of age, is married to Beatrice, and together they have been blessed with two children, ages six and four years. Beatrice sells fish to provide additional income for the family. Frederick has been a cobbler for the last 15 years, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 30,000.

Fredrick has requested his first loan with VisionFund Kenya for Kshs.10,000 to buy tools and shoe soles. With the anticipated profits, he will be able to expand his business further. 

Fredrick hopes for and dreams of a prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy tools and shoe soles

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en: Ruta is a 26-year-old mother with one child, and has a business selling pancakes, pork cakes and buns in her village to earn a living. Ruta has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, bottle of vegetable oil, plastic bags, a fry pan and yeast to assist her in operating the business. She has been doing this for more than a year. Ruta hopes to build a small bakery store in the near future and provide for her family needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, bottle of vegetable oil, plastic bags, a fry pan and yeast.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa lives at Tuguegarao with her family.

She and her spouse are involved in a furniture making business and get good income from it. It was used to sustain their needs and cover their bills.

Teresa wanted to keep improving their business, so that is why she is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy varnish, wood and nails to use in the furniture business. This loan will help provide good output and improve their sales and income as well.

loans.use: to buy varnish, wood and nails to use in the furniture business

loans.name: Zumrat

texts.ru: Зумрат жительница района А.Чоми. Ей 43 лет. Она замужем и имеет детей. Зумрат любит домашние животных, и по этой причине, она занимается животноводством. Она была занята с этой деятельностью уже более 10 лет. Зумрат имеет свой собственный земельный участок, где она заботится о своих животных.  Она покупает молодых телят, откармливает их в течение нескольких месяцев, прежде чем перепродать на рынке. Зумрат обращается за  кредитом, чтобы  увеличить численность скота и расширить бизнес животноводства. Она ждет Вашу доброту и надеется, что ей не откажут.
texts.en: Zumrat lives in the A. Jomi Region. She is 43 years old, married and has children. Zumrat likes farm animals, which is why she raises livestock. She has been engaged in this work for over ten years already. Zumrat has her own land plot, where she raises her animals. She buys young calves, fattens them for several months and then resells at the market. Zumrat is applying for a loan to increase her headcount and expand her livestock business. She is counting on your kindness and hopes that her request will not be denied.

loans.use: to buy calves so as to increase her headcount and expand her livestock business.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is 48 years old, married and had two children.

Madelyn has a store selling grocery items to her neighbors at Tuguegarao. She joined ASKI and availed herself of a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional stock of groceries such as canned goods, noodles, soap, shampoo, and biscuits. This will help increase her sales and save additional revenue for the family’s future expenses.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of groceries such as canned goods, noodles, soap, shampoo, and biscuits

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders! Meet Solomon, a 24-year-old young and energetic man who is so humble, honest, and a very hardworking man on this planet Earth. Solomon has siblings who he really adores so much and will always do anything good so that they never go to bed with hungry stomachs.

Solomon hails from the Kapsowar area of Kenya. He never got the opportunity to advance his education and get a white-collar job, but this did not kill his dream of wanting to succeed in life. Solomon started farming and has been doing farming for the past six years. Throughout those years, he has gathered so much experience, and all the farming techniques are at his fingertips. Solomon practices mixed farming on his farm. Through the profits, he has managed to take care of his siblings’ needs and give them a good education because he believes that education is the only “key to success”.

Solomon is a man who is very enterprising. He is seeking a loan of KES 40,000 to start horticulture farming on his farm. Because of favorable weather patterns, a good road network in his village, good soil, and a ready market for horticulture products, Solomon wants to take advantage of that and reap more profits. Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help aspiring men like Solomon to make their farming dreams come to reality through training and loan financing.

Solomon hopes that through the loan, he will improve his living conditions. Solomon’s dreams and projections are that by the end of the first year, he will not only be selling in the local market, but will also be selling in international markets through exporting fruits and vegetables. Through this, he will be able to assure his siblings a secure future and uninterrupted learning because he will be able to pay tuition fees on time.

Solomon is not a selfish man and will also want to impact positively on society. That is why he will employ people to work for him on his horticulture farm, hence having an impact on society.

loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Josiah

texts.en:
Josiah, a father of three, lives in the remote village of Bonyunyu in Nyamira, an area known to have high demand for poultry products. Josiah practices mixed farming, growing bananas, maize, and a variety of food crops. 

Of all the activities in which he is involved, poultry farming is closest to his heart. Waking up every morning to collect eggs makes him very proud. Feeding his poultry is his hobby. Josiah has always wanted to increase his poultry farming operation because the demand is overwhelming, but the biggest challenge has been lack of capital. 

Josiah has traits of a mobilizer, and he decided to mobilize other small-scale farmers who share this common problem. Together, they joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance organization that uses a co-guarantee mechanism to provide agricultural-based loans. Josiah is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. With the loan, he will be able to buy more poultry and satisfy the overwhelming demand. Through the loan he will significantly increase his sales, and this will translate to more profits. 

Demand for chicken is high in Nyamira; it is a popular meal for many people, and fast food joints are always full. Increased profits will allow Josiah to improve his living conditions and to get out of the poverty-stricken situation he is currently in. Other than profits, he will also benefit from poultry manure, which has higher nitrogen than livestock manure. Through the loan, Josiah sees a brighter future. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman and has been blessed with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Saumu operates a business selling poultry, which has been operational for over ten years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Saumu dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. With the loan of 10,000 KES she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Edson's Group

texts.en:
Edson is the leader of his group in Matete District, and he is representing 8 farmers, including himself. He is married and a proud father of 3 children. He  joined One Acre Fund for the first time this season, but he has been a farmer for 20 years.

Like many other farmers, Edson decided to work with One Acre Fund in order to earn enough to feed his family. He hopes that by joining One Acre Fund and using the seeds and fertilizer he will get with this loan, he can join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. He plans to use the profits he earns from this year’s harvest to send his children to school.

Edson's Group will use the farming inputs received with this loan to cultivate a total of 4.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 5 solar lights. Some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package, though Edson decided not to.

loans.use: to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom, an honest and hardworking married father of six, lives in Kagadi where he has been keeping poultry to supplement his income from a salary. He hopes to have electricity in his poultry house. 

Tom is requesting a loan to pay for wires, switches, sockets and labour to improve his poultry house.

loans.use: to pay for wires, switches, sockets and labour to improve his poultry house.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in her rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past year, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 10,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marlyn is 46 years old and both of her children are in school.

Marlyn has a buy-and-sell copra (the dried meat, or kernel, of the coconut, used to extract coconut oil) business in the Philippines. Marlyn requested a 30000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy copra and other materials to use in her business.

Marlyn has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Marlyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy copra and other material to use in her business

loans.name: Vagaga

texts.en:
Vagaga is a 47-year-old woman with 5 children who owns and operates a small business in her community to earn a living.

Vagaga has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, shovel, rake, chemicals, wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves and safety boots to assist the business. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Vagaga will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2014

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, shovel, rake, chemicals, wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves and safety boots

loans.name: Chhean

texts.en:
Chhean, 28, lives in Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of two children, who are currently in school. To make a living, she has been in the farming business, growing rice and selling her agricultural products to local dealers and customers on the market. Besides this, she also raises pigs for sale. On average, she generates an earning of 7.00 USD per day. 

Chhean wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine for her household.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is a mother from Plaridel, Philippines. She is 60 years old and has four children who are all adults.

Lucena is managing her fishing activities. She owns a fishing boat, and she has hired five fishermen to work for her. She personally sells the catch from their fishing boat in nearby municipalities.

Since she became a member of Paglaum MPC, she has been a member in good standing for almost 3 years. She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) for the purchase of new nets, foams, and other fishing accessories.

As much as possible, she needs to have all the needed fishing accessories to minimize chances of a low or zero catch. She already has floaters to help guard her fish cages. She also wants to buy the fish catch of her neighbors so she can sell more fish to the nearby fish market, where she will fetch higher prices. In the future, she dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales. She wishes to live a happy and comfortable life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase new nets, foams, and other fishing accessories.

loans.name: José Osmín

texts.es:
José, de 27 años de edad, está acompañado, que estudió hasta cuarto grado, debido a que no tenían suficientes recursos económicos para apoyarlo con el estudio, está acompañado y su compañera de vida se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen dos hijos, de 4 y un año de edad.

José, en su casa tiene un taller de mecánica automotriz desde hace siete años y tiene 15 años de experiencia, prácticamente toda su vida se ha dedicado a este trabajo. 

José, aprendió este oficio gracias a que uno de sus tíos lo empleo en su taller y le enseño lo básico en mecánica automotriz, ahora tiene mucha experiencia en el área y es propietario de su taller.- Antes de comenzar a trabajar en el taller, se dedicaba a la siembra de granos básicos y era así que el sostenía económicamente a su familia.

Actualmente, además de trabajar en el taller, vende verduras y pescado en sus días libres, el horario de trabajo de José, es de 8:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m. de lunes a domingo.

El crédito lo utilizará para comprar un carro pick up, para  facilitar su trabajo y para transportar las verduras, las frutas y el pescado.- De esta manera podrá  hacer sus entregas más rápido y podrá llegar a lugares que debido a la falta de un medio de transporte no puede hacerlo.

Los planes de José, es ampliar más su taller automotriz y poder tener un negocio que le generare mayores ingresos económicos y poderle dar a su familia lo necesario, además de eso, poder construir su propia casa y así poder darle a su familia un lugar donde vivir mejor y más cómodamente.
texts.en:
José is 27 years old. He is in a relationship. He studied until the 4th grade because his family did not have sufficient economic resources to support him with his studies. His life partner does house work. They have two children who are 4 and 1 years old. José has had an auto mechanic shop in his house for seven years and he has 15 years of experience. Practically all of his life he has been dedicated to this work. José learned this trade thanks to one of his uncles who employed him at his shop and who taught him basic auto mechanics. Now he has a lot of experience on this topic and he is the owner of his shop. Before he began working in the shop he worked planting basic grains and through this he economically sustained his family. Currently, in addition to working in his shop he sells vegetables and fish on his free days. His working hours are from 8am to 4pm from Monday to Sunday. He will use this loan to purchase a pick-up truck to facilitate his work and to transport the vegetables, fruit and the fish. This way he will be able to do his deliveries more quickly and he will be able to arrive at the places that he currently cannot visit due to his lack of transportation. 

José plans to grow his auto shop and to be able to have a business that generates more economic earnings so he can give his family what they need. In addition, he will be able to build his own house and through this give to his family a place where they can live better and more comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase a pick-up truck to facilitate his auto mechanic work and to transport the vegetables, fruits and the fish.

loans.name: Nohelia Maria

texts.es:
Una enseñanza y negocio heredado por su madre es ahora el que tiene la señora Nohelia, quien todos los días desde tempranas horas de la madrugada sale a ordeñar sus vacas para llevar hasta la carretera los litros de leche que recoge, lo más dificultoso de esta profesión son el alto costos de los insumos tanto para que crezca el pasto, el alimento, vacunas y desinfectantes de las vacas, pero este el negocio que su familia ha empleado durante generaciones y piensa algún día dejarlo a alguno de sus 6 hijos quienes levanto junto con la ayuda de sus vacas, quienes dieron la leche que son el sustento de su familia.
Nohelia buscando contra restar la principal dificultad de los lecheros la cual es el bajo costo de venta del litro de leche, quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de dos vacas y así aumentar su producción diaria que sabe que alguna familia en Colombia la va a disfrutar.
texts.en:
Nohelia inherited knowledge and a business from her mother, and every day she goes out early in the morning to milk her cows and takes the liters of milk she collects all the way to the highway. The hardest part of this job is the high cost of supplies to grow grass, buy feed, and vaccines and disinfectant for the cows. But this is the business her family has run for generations and one day she plans to pass it on to one of her kids, who she raised with the help of her cows, who provided the milk that supported her family.
Nohelia is trying to overcome the main problem facing dairy farmers, the low sale price of a liter of milk. She wants to request a loan so that she can purchase two cows and that way increase her daily production of milk, knowing that somewhere a Colombian family will enjoy it.

loans.use: To purchase two cows.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Delia works hard to support her family.

She has a making and selling snack foods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Delia is borrowing 15000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like peanut, cooking oil, rice powder, etc. for her business.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like peanut, cooking oil, rice powder, etc. for her snack food business.

loans.name: Guliston

texts.ru:
Гулистон проживающая на районе Файзобод 45 лет. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Муж, как и многие жители Республики находиятся на заработках в Российской Федерации. Ее дочкам 15 и 10 лет, сыну 12 лет. 
   Гулистон окончила Национальный Государственный Университет. После окончания университета она решила стать врачом и помогать людям. Она сразу поступила в медицинский колледж. Вот уже 20 лет она работает медсестрой. Также в свободное время от работы она проводит время за швейной машинкой. 
  Причина обращения Гулистон за кредитом является покупка мебели. Она долгое время мечтала купить новую мебель для дома. Много лет Гуличтон не обновляла апартаменты в доме и свой доход она всегда тратила на обеспечения семьи. Гулистон поистине заслужила улучшить себе условия жилища. Все эти годы она жила и работала и жертвовала себя для семьи. 
  Гулистон надеется, что Вы ей не откажете в кредите, и она сможет улучшить качество своей жизни.
texts.en:
Guliston, who resides in the Fayzabad region of Tajikistan, is 45 years old, married, and has three children.  Her daughters are 15 and 10, and her son is 12.  Guliston's husband, like many residents of the country, is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation.

Guliston is a graduate of Tajik National State University.  After graduating, she decided to become a medical professional and help people.  She immediately enrolled in a vocational school for medicine, and has worked as a nurse for the past 20 years.  In addition, she spends her free time away from work on a sewing machine.

The reason Guliston is seeking a loan is to buy furniture.  For a long time, she's dreamed of buying new furniture for her home.  She hasn't made any new additions or renovations to the rooms in her home for many years and has always spent her money to provide for her family.  Guliston really deserves to improve her home's living conditions.  All these years, she's lived and sacrificed for the benefit of her family.  She hopes that you won't deny her this loan, and that she'll be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: buy furniture to improve the living conditions of her home

loans.name: Tufala

texts.en:
Tufala is a 29-year-old mother with 1 child and has a business of selling pancakes, pork cakes, and buns in her village to earn a living.

Tufala has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, bottle of vegetable oil, plastic bags, fry pan, and yeast to assist her in operating the business. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Tufala hopes to build a small bakery store in the near future and provide for her family's needs. She became a member of SPBD 2014.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, bottle of vegetable oil, plastic bags, fry pan and yeast

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy plastic shoes in various styles for resale.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 27-year-old lady who runs a small business of selling elei prints in her community. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Caroline requested for a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, and elei designs to run her business. She will expand her business by using her profit. Caroline joined SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, and elei designs.

loans.name: Patilise

texts.en:
Patilise is a 50-year-old woman with seven children. She operates a small business of selling elei printing materials at the market to earn a living.

Patilise has requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, elei designs, containers, and a printing machine to assist her run the business. She has been doing this for more than 2 years. Patilise hopes to build a small elei shop in her village in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, elei designs, containers, and a printing machine.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 36 years. She is married to Edward and together they have been blessed with seven children between the ages of 5 and 15 years. Florence sells poultry, a business she has done for the last four years, earning a monthly income of KES 4,000.

Florence has requested for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 15,000, which she will use to add stock of poultry. With the anticipated profits, she will be able to expand her business further. Her hope and dream for the future is to live a successful and much better life than she does currently.

loans.use: to add stock of poultry

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en:
Vincent is a 32-year-old, hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has four children, ages 8, 6, 4, and 2 years. Of these, three are in school. Vincent is a produce dealer and also grows coffee, maize, and bananas to help him meet his family's expenditures on food and other requirements. According to him, his business is profitable. He faces a challenge of price fluctuations for the produce, however he hopes to expand his business to a big store. 

Vincent is requesting a loan to buy beans, coffee, and maize to stock his business.

loans.use: to buy beans, coffee, and maize to stock his business.

loans.name: Luka

texts.en:
Hello there! The above picture presents to you Luka, who lives in the Kapsowar area of Kenya, also known as the mango region because it produces the highest quality mangoes in the world. Luka is the father of one lovely child and has been doing farming for the past twelve years. Through dairy farming and poultry keeping, he has been able to produce milk and eggs. Luka is a very dedicated farmer who has a never-say-die attitude and enjoys every bit of farming because, through farming, he is able to take care of his family’s needs and wants. Although he experiences challenges in farming, his attitude keeps him going. Enjoying what he does, he has even nicknamed his cow “lovii.”

Luka is seeking a 65,000 KES loan to buy a chaff cutter. A chaff cutter is a mechanical device that is used to cut hay into small pieces before mixing it with other forage. This assists the animal in digestion and prevents the animal from rejecting any part of the food. With the loan, he will be able to increase his milk productivity and also increase his income, hence reducing the poverty that is currently facing him. Luka's biggest dream is to get out of poverty, and this loan will be a stepping stone toward improving the living standards of his family and increasing his income level.

loans.use: To buy a chaff cutter to help feed his cow.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 30-year-old married man living in Kagadi-Uganda with 4 children. He has been operating a salon, in addition to raising goats and farming, since 2010. He is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics to boost his business.

In spite of the challenge of his customers' low incomes affecting his business returns, Joseph hopes to accumulate assets and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to boost his business.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is living with her parents in Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Philippines. She is 43 years old and single.

Shirley is managing a direct selling business. She sells products for men, women and children like soap, lotion, perfume, clothes, shoes, sandals, cosmetics and others. She has had this business for 8 years. She found it interesting because she can earn income in an easy way through her good and effective salesmanship.

She requested a loan to purchase more stock to offer more to her customers. Expanding her inventory would also mean an increase to her income. Shirley has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, she hopes to arrange a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to offer more to her customers

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.en:
Maria Luz is 50 years old, married and lives at Magcamiguing, Calamba, Philippines.

In order to earn a living, she takes in and raises pigs from their neighborhood.  The piglets' owners share in the profit upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30 depending on their agreement.  With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own as well. 

Through Paglaum PC she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed. Now, she requests a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy additional feed. 

She really hopes and prays that her business would grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to hire labor to cut mulch for his farm

loans.name: Mwamasai

texts.en:
Mwamasai is a married woman with four children, all of whom still attend school and are still under her care. They live in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwamasai operates a clothes selling business at the market, where she sells to town dwellers and her neighbors. With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale to earn profits and continue sustaining her family. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for resale to earn profits and continue sustaining her family

loans.name: Beti

texts.en:
Beti is a married woman with four kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Beti has operated a vegetable stall for four years now. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high costs of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the KES 20,000, Beti wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 39 years old and married with one child, who in school. Jennifer works very hard to provide for her family.

Jennifer runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 7000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc.

Jennifer has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, Jennifer would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 50 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries to sell. Yolanda has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Yolanda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Ruben Dario

texts.es:
Ruben, de 54 años, tiene gran experiencia en el área de la confección gracias a sus múltiples empleos en diferentes fabricas donde trabajaba como operario de maquinas de confección.

Hoy en día es un hombre independiente y gana sus propios ingresos a través de la confección a terceros y una pequeña línea propia.

Es un hombre muy emprendedor y su motivación más grande para trabajar son sus hijos quienes en algunas ocasiones le ayudan en su negocio.

El tiene muchos proyectos los cuales desea cumplir en la medida de lo posible, pero para eso necesita la ayuda de una auxilio económico el cual le permitirá inyectarle capital a su negocio a través de la compra de una maquina ojaladora.

Con este préstamo el podrá mantener su actividad vigente y podrá ofreciendo empleo a las personas del sector.
texts.en:
Ruben, 54 years old, has great experience in the sewing business thanks to his multiple jobs in different factories, where he worked as a sewing machine operator. Nowadays he is an independent man and earns his own income through sewing for others and his own small line of products.

He is a very entrepreneurial man and his greatest motivation to work are his children, who sometimes help him in his business. He has many projects that he wishes to fulfil to the greatest degree possible, but in order to do this, he needs the help of an economic assistance that will permit him to inject capital to his business through the purchase of a buttonhole machine.

With this loan he will be able to keep his current activity and will be able to offer employment to the people in the area.

loans.use: to buy a buttonhole machine

loans.name: Laau

texts.en:
Laau is a 46-year-old mother with 6 children and has a small business of selling vegetables (cabbage, eggplant, and cucumber) in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for over 2 years.

Laau has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots to assist her in running the business. Laau hopes to expand her business by using her profit in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is hardworking and industrious father. He is known in their neighbourhood area being a "tuba" (coconut wine) gatherer. Everyday he sells and delivers his "tuba" in the public market and earns 400 PHP daily from it. This is how he supported his five children with their needs for more than 10 years. He became a member of PMPC and appreciates the various programs and services that the coop offers. 

He hopes to live comfortably with a decent house, for which he applied for a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for safe and comfortable living. 

He hopes to maintain his membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that he has been given a priority, as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what he is thankful for, when all his financing needs are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for safe and comfortable living.

loans.name: Randy

texts.en:
Randy is age 45 and married, and they are blessed with one child. He has managed a hog raising business for almost 24 years and earns a net income of 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) every three months. His net income on this business is usually spent on his agricultural needs. 

Due to insufficient funds in his business, Randy would like a loan amounting to 25,000 PHP to purchase two piglets and hog feeds for his hogs. He's hoping that his business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase 2 piglets and hog feeds for his hogs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics, clothing, natural products, pajamas, etc.

loans.name: Stella Marina

texts.es: Stella es una mujer de 55 años de edad, residente de un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla, ella realiza manualidades en porcelanicron y foamy, como cuadernos, lámparas, adornos para la cocina, muñecas, y otros artículos que se pueden elaborar con estos productos.   Stella emprendió esta labor por la solicitud de sus amigos y familiares quienes le realizan pedidos de estos productos para recordatorios de fiestas y detalles. Alterno a esta actividad y en compañía de su cónyuge comercializan carne de res, lo cual les genera ingreso adicional para su familia. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará porcelanicron, aceite, pinturas, foamy para la elaboración de sus manualidades, también comprará carne para cumplir con unos pedidos este fin de año. Ella es madre de cuatro hijos y su meta familiar es organizar su negocio para tener una mayor cobertura, ella siempre trabajó con recursos familiares y su gran desafío ha sido acceder a la financiación.
texts.en:
Stella is a 55-year-old woman who resides in a neighborhood in the city of Barranquilla. She makes handicrafts out of polymer clay and craft foam such as notebooks, lamps, kitchen decorations, dolls, and other items that can be made from these materials. Stella started her business after friends and relatives placed orders for party favors and gifts. She divides her time between this business and helping her husband sell beef, which is a source of additional income for her family.

Stella is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the money to buy polymer clay, oil, paints, and craft foam for making handicrafts. In addition, she will buy meat in order to fulfill a few year-end orders. Stella is the mother of four children and her goal is to organize her business so that she can offer a wider range of products. She has always worked with her family’s resources, so her greatest challenge is being able to obtain financing.

loans.use: to buy polymer clay, oil, paints, and craft foam for making handicrafts, and to buy beef in order to fulfill orders for her husband's business.

loans.name: Ahror

texts.ru: Ахрор  молодой женатый  мужчина   ему  34 года.    Он живет вместе с родителями в городе. У его семьи  есть небольшой земельный участок на котором они выращивает и сушит фрукты. Также  его семья разводит домашний скот. Ахрор имеет хороший опыт  в этом деле.  Для его семьи выращивание и продажа скота на убой это основной источник дохода.  Ахрор трудолюбивый мужчина и чтобы обеспечить хорошее будущее для своей  семьи и для родителей  он работает не покладая рук. Сейчас он хочет увеличить поголовье скота и для этой цели ему недостает средств. Ахрор решил обратиться в банк за кредитом так как сейчас как раз можно подешевле купить скот. Он хочет купить телят для  выращивания и в будущем для продажи. А также   с наступлением зимы ему необходимо запастись кормами,  чтобы  долгую зиму  его питомцы провели без проблем в корме. При поддержке организации Арванд  Ахрор хочет увеличить доходность своей семьи.
texts.en: Ahror is a young, married 34-year-old man. He lives with his parents in the town. His family has a small land plot, where they grow and dry fruits. His family also raises livestock. Ahror has a good experience in this business. Fattening up and selling livestock for meat is his sole source of income. Ahror is a hardworking man and, to provide a good future for this family and parents, works without rest. Now he wants to increase his livestock headcount and does not have enough money to accomplish this goal. Ahror decided to request a loan from the bank because he can buy livestock cheaper now. He wants to buy calves for fattening and subsequent resale. And also with the onset of winter, he needs to stock up on livestock feed, so that his livestock could get through the long winter without shortage in feed. With the support of the Arvand organization, Ahror wants to increase his family's income.

loans.use: to buy calves for fattening and subsequent resale

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 23 years old. She is married to Joshua and together they have been blessed with 2 children of 13 and 7 years. Joshua provides additional income for their family.

Caroline sells retail goods, a business she has done for the last 7 years, earning a monthly income of KSH 8,500. Caroline has requested for her 1st loan with VisionFund Kenya for KSH 30,000, which she will use to add stocks of retail goods for resale at profit. With the anticipated profits, Caroline will be able to expand her business further.

Caroline's hopes and dreams for the future are to prosper.

loans.use: buy goods to resell

loans.name: Mati

texts.en:
Mati is 27 years old with 1 child. She runs a small business selling elei prints (Samoan printed cloth) in her community. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Mati has requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, and elei designs to run the business. She will expand her business by using her profit. Mati joined SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, and elei designs

loans.name: Marta Cecilia

texts.es:
Ella es Marta, adorable, consentida, trabajadora, inteligente y emprendedora mujer que cuenta con la bendición de Dios en matrimonio.
Gracias a su tienda donde oferta variedad de surtido entre víveres, granos, dulces, frituras, productos refrigerados, harinas entre otros, le han generado el sustento necesario para llevar a su hogar un plato de comida digno y que ahora pide a gritos que lo abastezcan pues está muy bajo de surtido y Marta no tiene el capital para hacerlo, por ello llega donde su aliado de confianza Interactuar para solicitar un crédito para la compra de productos refrigerados, granos, víveres, su mayor sueño a sus 49 años de edad es que su negocio perdure en el tiempo y que la acompañe hasta el final de sus Días.
texts.en: This is Marta. She is an adorable, hard-working, intelligent, and enterprising woman who depends on God to bless her marriage. In her store she offers a variety of stock, including household goods, basic food items, fried goods, refrigerated products, flour, and more. She is thankful that her store has generated the necessary support to provide food for her home and now she asks for help as her stock is very low and Marta doesn't have the capital to stock it. Therefore she has trustfully aligned with Interactuar to seek a loan to buy refrigerated goods, basic food items, and household goods. Her primary dream, at 49 years old, is that her business lasts over time and that she can work there through her final days.

loans.use: to buy refrigerated goods, basic food items, and household goods.

loans.name: Sulait

texts.en:
Sulait is a 29-year-old married man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a poultry farmer. Sulait faces a challenge of limited capital; however, he hopes to expand his poultry business and educate his children to a high level of learning. 

Sulait needs a loan to buy poultry feed.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred is a fifty-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a sugarcane plantation and sells coffee, pineapples, bananas, sorghum and millet to earn him more income. He started this business because it was easy for him to start. He intends to use the loan requested to hire labor to weed the sugarcane plantation. He hopes to expand his plantation and improve on the volume of yields in the near future, however the challenge is pests and diseases.

loans.use: hire laborers

loans.name: Lucina

texts.en:
Lucina is 36 years old and a single mother of 2 children. She has a beauty salon business in Eldoret town.  She has been in the business for the last 10 years and it has been profitable.

Lucina has requested a loan from VisionFund Kenya which she will use to buy a blow dryer machine and chairs for use in her salon business. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. 

This is Lucina's seventh loan term and she has repaid her previous loans successfully. Her future hopes are to be successful in her business and ensure that her children are well educated.

loans.use: buy a hair dryer and salon chairs

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a thirty-year-old hardworking married man with four children aged 10, 8, 6 and 1 year. He is a farmer and issues operation permits to earn more income. He wants to buy coffee in the coming season, but his main challenge is inadequate capital.

loans.use: buy coffee

loans.name: Aramanzani

texts.en: Aramanzani is a 35-year-old married man with 4 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His business is providing motorcycle transport and at the same time is a farmer growing food crops like bananas and maize.  He faces challenges of little capital, however, he hopes of having a good business and a healthy family. He has asked for a loan to buy iron sheets for his house construction.

loans.use: buy iron sheets

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en: Prisca is a 48-year-old single lady with 2 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She is a farmer, rearing piglets and growing rice. She faces challenges of limited capital, however, she hopes to educate all her children to higher levels of learning. Prisca needs a loan to buy piglets for rearing.

loans.use: buy piglets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy land

loans.name: Sibabu

texts.en:
Sibabu has six kids, three of whom still attend school and three of whom have finished school. She lives in a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Sibabu operates a fruit and vegetable stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces challenges of competition and seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 20,000 loan, Sibabu wants to purchase sacks of fruits, including oranges and bananas, and green vegetables for resale. She dreams of expanding and establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruit, including oranges and bananas, and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Nimbwata

texts.en:
Nimbwata is married with six children who attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

Nimbwata operates an open air food business, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a wholesale business in the near future. 

With this KSH 20,000 loan, Nimbwata wants to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy flour, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Esmira

texts.en:
Esmira is 40 years old. She is married and lives with her son and husband in the Gardabani district. Her husband is an artisan and takes orders to repair houses. 

Esmira wants to cultivate family-owned land and grow greens. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,300 GEL. 

With the received credit she will purchase seeds and cultivate the land, and then sell the harvested greens to generate income.

loans.use: to cultivate family-owned land and grow greens.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the kids.

Mariam operates a vegetable selling stall, selling at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale cereals shop business in the near future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman and has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Alii

texts.en:
Alii is married and has seven children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, Alii has operated a coconut selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

Alii is requesting for a loan to purchase six sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy coconuts

loans.name: Hasmani

texts.en:
Hasmani is a married woman and has been blessed with four children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband and children, she lives in their own house, which neither has electricity nor piped water. 

Hasmani has operated a fish selling business for over five years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby.  With this KSH 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: buy fish

loans.name: Binapani Group

texts.en:
In December 2014, 13 women from Pendrapadar village in Balangir district in Odisha, India formed a Self Help Group named Binapani to avail a loan from Mahashakti Foundation and develop their businesses. Anita, a straightforward and positive lady, is one of them. She hails from a lower middle class family. The lady standing second from left in the photo raising her hand is Anita. She is 28 years old and lives with her husband, two daughters who are nine and three years old, and one son who is five years of age.

Anita has an animal trading business that she has managed with the help of her husband for the last eight years. Her husband purchases goats by moving to weekly markets and sells them. In a week, he covers five nearby markets for this business. From this business, Anita gets a monthly income of 6,000 INR . Out of this income, she is hardly able to manage her household and business expenses. Although there is good market for this business, and Anita could have earned more income by purchasing more goats, finances were difficult for her. Therefore, she formed this SHG for expansion of her trading by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. By investing the present loan, Anita intends to purchase more numbers of goats to sell and earn more income. She hopes that this will help her in the future to construct a good house and provide a better education to her children. Of the other 12 members, three members are doing stone cutting work, two members are running a general store, one member is doing animal trading and four members are doing cultivation.

loans.use: To purchase more goats to sell and earn more income.

loans.name: Ali's Group

texts.en:
Ali is a 49-year-old proud father of 12 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing his group of 12 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Ali has noticed that he has a larger farm group support.

He described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during the night and have somewhere to charge his phone. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Ali’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Christopher's Group

texts.en:
Christopher is 25 years old and is often described as a very friendly person. As a group leader, Christopher is representing his group of 11 farmers in Matete District in Kenya. He is excited to be joining One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Christopher's desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods.

Apart from receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan, which is very exciting to him as he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. 

With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to repair his home.

Christopher and his group will receive a total of 7 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 4 acres.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Nayana Group

texts.en:
“Nayana”, a self-help group, was formed in November 2014 by eleven active women of Sirbhatapada of Titilagarh town of Balangir district in Odisha, India. The main purpose of forming this SHG is to access a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for the development of existing businesses for future growth.

Minakshi is one of the members of this group. She is standing with a raised hand in the photo. She is 36 years of age and lives with her husband, one son of eight years of age, and one daughter of six years of age. Minakshi hails from a poor family.

Minakshi has been running a stationery shop (office supplies) and photocopy center for the last seven years with the active help of her husband. She has engaged an employee for the smooth management of her business. For the amicable behavior and better service, customers are likely to come to her shop.

From this business, she earns a monthly income of 6,000 INR. From the present income, she is managing her family anyway, but she feels that in the future, when her children will grow and go for better education, there will be financial trouble for her. So, looking into the future needs of her family, she wants to expand her business.

As per the plan of Minakshi, from the present loan she will purchase a computer system with Internet facility and engage another employee for DTP (desktop publishing) work and managing the same. She expects a good return from this investment.

The only future dream of Minakshi is to give better schooling to her children.

The other ten members of the group are also doing businesses such as general store, tiffin stall, tailoring center, electronics shop, egg center, and pathology clinic.

loans.use: to purchase a computer system with Internet facility.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru:
Эту 39-летнюю женщину зовут Дилбар. Она родом из маленького района Яван. В ее семье живет 9 человек: это она, ее муж, шестеро дочерей и свёкор. Муж в основном работает за пределами страны, четверо старших дочерей учатся, а двое еще маленькие. Дилбар сама в течение 5 лет работает в дехканском хозяйстве и одновременно занимается животноводством. 
Как видно на фотографии Дилбар сейчас занимается вспашкой земли, после чего ей необходимо приступить к посевным работам. Однако Дилбар сейчас нуждается в средствах, чтобы приобрести семена овощей, минеральных удобрений и топлива. Для этой цели она обратилась за кредитом. Дилбар надеется на вашу финансовую помощь, без которого она не сможет провести этот посев.
texts.en: Dilbar is the name of this 39-year-old woman. She is a native of a small district of Yavan. Her family has 9 people: she, her husband, six daughters and father-in-law. Her husband primarily works abroad, four older daughters are students, and the other two are still very young. Dilbar has been working at a dekhan farm for 5 years and is concurrently involved in animal husbandry. As can be seen from the photograph, Dilbar is currently involved in plowing the land, after which she needs to start the sowing work; however, Dilbar now needs money to buy vegetable seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel. To accomplish this goal, she requested a loan. Dilbar hopes for your financial help, without which she would not be able to proceed with the sowing.

loans.use: to buy quality vegetable seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: Edwin Enrique

texts.es:
Edwin es un joven de 21 años de edad, campesino pero muy emprendedor e inteligente que adquirió unos terrenos pro herencia de su familia quienes lo entrenaron y lo capacitaros en todos o que hay que saber del campo, pero este creativo personaje vio que se generaban muchos tiempos muertos y por ello decidió ahorrar y montar una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, como abarrotes, víveres y algunos productos refrigerados.
El apoyo para las personas del campo siempre ha sido muy pobre pero tú puedes hacer la diferencia e interactuar quiere cambiar eso aprovechando su alianza con Kiva, apoya a la juventud campesina para que crezcan y sigan realizando su hermosa labor
texts.en:
Edwin is a 21 year old young man from the countryside but he is very enterprising and intelligent. He acquired some land through inheritance from his family who taught him everything there is to know about the countryside. But this creative person saw that his crops often failed so he decided to save and open a store selling basic needs products, such as groceries, household goods, and some refrigerated products.

The support for people from the countryside always has been poor but you can make a difference and Interactuar wants to change that by taking advantage of its alliance with Kiva, supporting the rural youth so that they grow and continue with their beautiful labor.

loans.use: to buy products such as groceries, household goods, and some refrigerated products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a cooler.

loans.name: Carlito

texts.en:
Carlito is from Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. He is a very responsible father when it comes to the welfare of his family since he has always been known to provide the best for his family.

He is earning a living in his burger vending business. To generate more income, Carlito decided to expand his resources after he learned that he can access financial assistance from PMPC. Consequently, he requested a loan to purchase more burger buns and pay for ingredients for patties for his business.  He also accepts orders, especially this holiday season.

Someday, he hopes to own burger stands near schools. Carlito smiles at the thought of having a comfortable life and providing his family with a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more burger buns and pay for ingredients for patties for his business

loans.name: Rukhsora

texts.ru: Рухсора молодая образованная женщина в возрасте 26 лет. Она в течение 2 лет работает оператором в местном банке своего города Конибодом. Рухсора замужем и имеет дочку и сына. Муж Рухсоры зарабатыает на жизнь предоставляя услуги такси. К сожалению в данный момент его машина не пригодна для продолжения деятельности. Ему нужно купить новую, чтобы не остаться без работы. Для этой цели у него однако нет собственных средств. Жена видит безвыходное положение мужа и очень хочет помочь ему. Она берет кредит, чтобы купить ему новую автомашину. Рухсора верит в вашу помощь и не хочет, чтобы ее муж остался без работы. Она надеется только на лучшее.
texts.en: Rukhsora is a young, educated 26-year-old woman. She has been working as an operator at a local bank in her town of Konibodom for 2 years. Rukhsora is married and has a daughter and a son. Rukhsora's husband earns a living by providing taxi services. Unfortunately, at the present time his car is not suitable to continue his business. He needs to buy a new car, so that he is not left without work; however, he does not have his own money to accomplish this goal. His wife sees her husband's stalemate and really wants to help him. She is requesting a loan to buy him a new car. Rukhsora believes in your help and does not want her husband to be left without work. She hopes only for the best.

loans.use: to buy a car for her husband, so that he could continue his taxi work

loans.name: Godlove

texts.en:
Godlove is married with no children, living in a three-room house in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon. He hates thinking about the death of his daughter, sickness, and the poverty he has tasted. 

He is very confident that his business will be successful because he has perfect knowledge about the business, the strategic location of the business, and also because he supplies many customers.

The loan from Ghape will be used to purchase spare parts such as radiators, windscreens, engine plugs, tires, driving mirrors, wheel drums and other  engine parts. The community will benefit by buying the spare parts at cheaper prices.

With the profit from the business, Godlove will be able to expand his business. He prefers a loan from Ghape because it has low interest rates, a new loan can be given as soon as you finish the old one, and also because of the fact that GHAPE offers non-financial services, including training and social networking during bi-monthly center meetings.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts such as a radiators, windscreens, engine plugs, tires, driving mirrors, wheel drums and other engine parts.

loans.name: Analyne

texts.en:
Analyne is juggling a business and supervising the construction of their new home. Analyne hopes to live comfortably in a house with good roofing, supported by her loan of 40,000 PHP, to purchase construction materials to make a safe and comfortable living space for her family. 

She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record. It matters that Analyne has been given a priority as a microfinance member of PMPC. This is what she is thankful for, when all her financing needs on her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for making a safe and comfortable living space for her family.

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Segundo Gilberto

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 37 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia con su cónyuge y su hijo en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Esta comunidad está habitada por gente que se dedica principalmente a la agricultura y crianza de animales.

El se dedica a la crianza de ganado lechero (vacas), cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Adicionalmente se dedica a brindar servicios como peón agrícola en su distrito. El presente crédito será utilizado para la compra de animales como cerdos, cuyes, gallinas y pavos así como para alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos. Con esto Segundo espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes lo que le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo, 37, is in a civil union and lives in his own house with his partner and his son in the Cayalti District, located in Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Region, on the north coast of Peru.  This community is inhabited by people who make a living principally from agriculture and animal husbandry.
He makes a living raising milk cows.  He has experience in the business and very good personal and work references in the zone.  In addition, he offers his services as a agricultural day laborer in his district. The current loan will be used to buy animals such as pigs, guinea pigs, chickens, and turkeys as well as balanced feed with which to fatten them.  With this, Segundo hopes to offer a better variety of animals to his customers which will allow him to increase the level of his income and improve the quality of his life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy animals such as pigs, guinea pigs, chickens, and turkeys as well as balanced feed with which to fatten them up.

loans.name: Milton Adgusto

texts.es:
A medida que pasa el tiempo, las cosechas de Milton cada vez son más grandes, la siembra de tabaco, chiltoma y tomate han mejorado su calidad, logró con el cual se siente muy feliz. Así mismo se siente muy agradecido con las personas que lo apoyaron con el préstamo anterior, ya que muchos de sus avances fueron gracias a este último. Ahora con este éxito, este agricultor de 43 años de edad se siente más que listo para su próxima cosecha.
Por esta razón es que Milton ha decidido solicitar un nuevo préstamo para comprar fertilizantes, abono, insecticidas y para pagar mano de obra de la próxima siembra de tabaco. Con esto podrá seguir cultivando una de las mejores cosechas de su ciudad, obtener mayores ganancias y podrá seguir sustentando a su esposa e hijos. Al cancelar este crédito piensa empezar a sembrar tomate.
texts.en:
As time passes, Milton's harvests are greater each time.  The tobacco, sweet pepper and tomato crops have improved in quality, an achievement which makes him feel happy.  At the same time, he feels very grateful to the people who supported him with the previous loan since many of his advances came about due to this last one.  Now with this success, this 43-year-old farmer feels more than ready for the next harvest.
For this reason, Milton has decided to request a new loan in order to buy fertilizers, manure, insecticides, and to pay the labor costs for the next tobacco planting.  With this, he will be able to continue cultivating one of the best crops in his city, obtain better profits, and continue sustaining his wife and children.  After paying off this loan, he is thinking of starting to plant tomatoes.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, insecticides, and to pay the labor costs.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 23 years old. He is married to Caroline and together they have been blessed with 1 child who is now 4 years old.

Moses is a retailer, a business he has operated for the last 5 years, earning a monthly income of about Kshs 20,000. He has requested a loan from VisionFund Kenya of Kshs 10,000 which he will use to add a stock of retail goods.

With the anticipated profits, Moses will be able to expand his business further. His hopes and dreams for the future are to continually add stock of retail goods.

loans.use: to add a stock of retail goods.

loans.name: Myladis Del Carmen

texts.es: Myladis es una mujer ama de casa, que vive en la zona rural, habita donde por lo general una persona cultiva su propio alimento y vende lo demás, pero no todo lo pueden tener hay cosas que solo pueden conseguir en una tienda y el inconveniente es que la más cerca está en un pueblo que queda a 1 hora o incluso más, pero empresarias como Myledis que tienen su tienda cercana para que sus vecinos se beneficien y ella pueda generar sus propios recursos, vende productos de la canasta familiar muy enfocados en los productos de aseo y algunos medicamentos básicos, solicita un crédito para la compra de medicamentos, productos de aseo personal y aseo doméstico y productos de primera necesidad que son pocos comunes entre los cultivos de sus vecinos.
texts.en: Myladis is a housewife who lives in a rural area. In this area people generally grow their own food and sell the extra, but there are things that can only be obtained in a store and it is inconvenient that the closest store is in a town 1 hour or more away. But entrepreneurs like Myledis who have a store nearby for her neighbors benefits everyone and she can generate her own income. She sells basic products, focusing on personal and home care products and some basic medicines. She seeks a loan to buy medicines, personal care products, home care products, and basic needs items that are not common among the items from her neighbors.

loans.use: to buy medicines, personal care products and home care products.

loans.name: Samui

texts.en:
In order to earn a living Samui, a 65-year-old mother of 10, has had a business selling pancakes, pork cakes and buns in her village for more than three years. She has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, a bottle of vegetable oil, plastic bags, a fry pan and yeast for her enterprise.

Samui hopes to build a small bakery store in the near future and provide for her family's needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2010.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, a bottle of vegetable oil, plastic bags, a fry pan and yeast

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael tiene 38 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su esposa e hijos en casa propia en una comunidad grande en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con más de 15 años de experiencia en el negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y comerciales de el. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos para incrementar el stock de su negocio, de esta manera Rafael espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes satisfaciendo sus gustos y necesidades, lo que se verá reflejado en un aumento en su nivel de ingresos y le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rafael,38, is in a civil union and lives with his partner and children in his own house in a large community in the Cayalti District, located in Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Region, on the north coast of Peru.  Life in this district is tranquil.  The inhabitants make a living principally from agriculture, ranching, and commerce.
He makes a living from the sale of groceries such as rice, sugar, oil, and noodles amongst other things.  His business is located in his house.  He has more than 15 years of experience in the business and firm customers who offer very good personal and work references for him.  The loan will be used in order to purchase a greater quantity of products to increase the inventory of his business.  In this way, Rafael hopes to offer a greater variety of products to his customers satisfying their tastes and necessities, which will be reflected in an increase in the level of his income and will allow him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of products to increase the inventory of his business.

loans.name: Olga Patricia

texts.es:
Olga tiene una misión muy importante la cual es tener surtido suficiente para complacer unos clientes muy caprichosos y consentidos que son niños de escuela, gracias a esta tienda puede llevar el sustento a su hogar donde la esperan sus dos hijas de tan solo 4 y 2 años de edad, inicio su negocio a mediados del año 2009 y desde entonces ha podido mejorar sus condiciones de vida y vivir dignamente por lo menos con los atributos básicos.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de frituras en bolsa, dulces, frutas, refrescos y demás cosas que son muy solicitadas por los niños.
texts.en: Olga has a very important mission which is to have enough stock to satisfy some very demanding and whimsical customers - school children. Thanks to this store she can support her home where two daughters ages 4 and 2 wait for her. She began her business in mid-2009 and since then has been able to improve her living conditions and live with dignity with at least basic services. She seks a loan to buy bagged snacks, candy, fruit, soda pop and other items that are asked for frequently by the children.

loans.use: to buy bagged snacks, candy, fruit, and soda pop.

loans.name: Karaveri

texts.en: Karaveri is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He rears livestock and has a farm which helps him earn more income and earn a living. He has a vision of becoming rich. This has been limited by prolonged droughts. With the loan requested, Karaveri intends to buy more cows to add to his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows to add to his farm.

loans.name: Rajab

texts.en:
Rajab is a married woman with seven children. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the loan she is requesting of 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Eriya

texts.en: Eriya is a married man who lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He earns money from a workshop and from produce selling. However hardworking Eriya is, he is challenged by bad weather changes, making it difficult for him to transport his products to the market. He desires to grow his business. He is asking for a loan to buy metals for welding, to make doors and windows to sell.

loans.use: to buy metals for welding, to make doors and windows to sell.

loans.name: Arcilia Rosa

texts.es: Arcilia una mujer verdaderamente de admirar y de tener como referente en su larga trayectoria paso pro difíciles etapas, sabe que es aguantar hambre, sabe que es levantarse del suelo, ella es una madre de 6 hijos los cuales levanto y crio sola pues se separó de su esposo y gracias a sus cultivos y cerdos puede generar el sustento para todos ellos, una mujer que de verdad ama su familia y como dice el dicho “ se saca el bocado de comida de la boca para dárselo a sus hijos”,  y ahora necesita tu apoyo para progresar, mejorar sus ingresos, quiere inscribir a sus hijos en una escuela, mejorar sus condiciones de vida, por tal motivo solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos como abonos, riegos, pesticidas e insecticidas y porcinos para mejorar su negocio y esperar mejor rentabilidad para cumplir sus metas.
texts.en: Arcilia is a truly admirable person and during her long trajectory has gone through some difficult times. She knows what it is to go hungry. She knows what it is pick herself up off the ground. She is the mother of 6 children who she raised on her own because she separated from her husband, and thanks to her crops and pigs, she was able to generate enough to provide for them. She is a woman who truly loves her family and, like the saying says, she "took the food from her mouth to give it to her children." Now she needs your help to make progress and improve her income. She wants to send her children to school and improve their living conditions. For this reason she is requesting a loan to buy inputs such as manure, fertilizers, pesticides, and insecticides, and pigs so she can improve her business and hope for better profits to acheive her goals.

loans.use: to buy inputs such as manure, fertilizers, pesticides, and insecticides.

loans.name: Ermek

texts.en:
Ermek is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of International and Comparative Politics. Here is his story:

“Since my childhood I wanted to study at American University of Central Asia and get a higher education here. Until this time, it was just a dream because the tuition fee is very expensive. Fortunately, I knew about financial aid, which includes a Kiva loan and thought that it’s the golden opportunity to study at AUCA and achieve my goals.

I always tried to study well, participated in educational-summer camps, went to the different trainings and took part in various projects. I finished the Lyceum for the best hardworking students, and took part in Olympiads such as Kyrgyz language Olympiad, History Olympiad and English Olympiad.
