Finally I was lucky to win an AUCA full Scholarship to study at one-year-study program at New Generation Academy. New Generation Academy opened for me the new academic world, presented new international friends and improved my leadership skills, my outlook and knowledge.

However, my family has financial difficulties, so I need a Kiva loan. I live with my parents. My mother works in the local hospital in our village. My father is officially unemployed, but sometimes he does construction in order to support our family. He would be able to work better if he had a Diploma, but unfortunately my grandparents hadn’t been able to give him a higher education. Due to it, my father tells me that a life becomes even harder without gaining special skills and I must study, study and study in order to be satisfied with myself and help my parents in the future.”

loans.use: to pay for his higher education

loans.name: Rosa Candida

texts.es:
Rosa, elabora tortillas y alborotos (rosetas de maíz bañadas con miel) para vender, vive con su familia compuesta por su cónyuge, hijos y sobrinos; su esposo tiene una actividad económica diferente para cubrir las necesidades de su familia, su negocio nace por necesidad de tener ingresos para apoyar en los gastos de su hogar, su horario de trabajo es de diez de la mañana a dos de la tarde, en ambas ventas presenta muy buena estabilidad y sin problemas.
El préstamo le servirá para comprar maíz, maicillo, dulce de atado, cal, leña y otros materiales para mantener su negocio en el mercado, su objetivo es aumentar la producción, contar con nuevo clientes y tener mejores ganancias, sus riesgos son no vender todo el producto durante el día ya que no son de larga duración.
Sus sueños son mantener un negocio estable, hacer buen uso del crédito y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa makes tortillas and alborotos (rosettes of corn bathed in honey) to sell. She lives with her family which consists of her husband, children, and nephews. Her husband has a different job to cover the family's necessities. Her business is born out of necessity to have income to support the household expenses. She works from 10 AM until 2 PM, with sales of both products stable and without problems.

The loan will be used to buy corn, corn meal, sweetener, lime, firewood and other materials to maintain her business in the market. Her goal is to increase production, acquire new customers, and have greater earnings. Her risks are not selling all the product during the day as her days are not long. Her dreams are to maintain a stable business, make good use of the loan, and have her family get ahead.

loans.use: to buy corn, corn meal, sweetener, lime, firewood and other materials to maintain her business in the market.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is a 34-year-old single woman living with her parents and sibling. The family is hardly managing to pay everyday expenditures, and that’s what drove Amal to get involved in the professional career of selling clothes. She works from her home and she provides her clientele with an extensive selection of glamorous designs. Presently, she seeks to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to buy a large quantity of clothes and be able to attract more customers. Therefore she will sell more, and hence gain more profits.

loans.use: buy a large quantity of clothes

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is a 54-year-old single woman supporting four relatives at home. She runs a tailoring business at her house and she is well known in her community for being a hard and honest worker. She has been in this business for 30 years and she is well qualified. With the loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, she will purchase embroidery machinery. Fatmeh states that acquiring this will ease her work and will help her serve a bigger number of customers, and consequently her revenue will increase.

loans.use: purchase embroidery machinery

loans.name: Rosa Geoconda

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 23 años de edad tiene un hijo de 4 años vive con su  esposo  y su hijo en San Miguel provincia de Bolivar en la comunidad Santo Cristo , pertenece a la ventanilla rural San Francisco.

Ella se dedica a la cria de chanchos y gallinas, solicita el credito para la compra de chanchos y gallinas, para el balanceado de engorde y para lo necesario para arreglar los galpones. Realiza las compras cada tres meses, su sueño es mejorar en su negocio y salir adelante con su familia. En su tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasearse con su hija y jugar.
texts.en:
Rosa is 23 years old and has a 4 year-old child. She lives with her husband and her child in San Miguel, in the province of Bolivar, in the community of Santo Cristo. She belongs to the "San Francisco" communal bank.

She raises pigs and chickens. She is requesting the loan in order to buy pigs and chickens, balanced feed to fatten them, and the things she needs to repair her chicken coops. She makes her purchases every three months. Her dream is to improve her business and to get ahead with her family. In her free time she likes to spend time with her daughter and play.

loans.use: to buy animals for fattening.

loans.name: Saniyeh

texts.en: Saniyeh is a 62-year-old Lebanese single woman living with four relatives. She works every day of the week to make a satisfactory net average of income so she can support her relatives. She has specialized in producing homemade food for the past 35 years. Her major clients are from her town and neighboring villages. Currently, and since her business is sometime slow because of lack of money, she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase products needed and particular machinery that will help her expedite her production.  Saniyeh is optimistic and very grateful to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase products needed and particular machinery that will help her expedite her production

loans.name: Hana

texts.en: Hana is a 54-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and only child. Despite her older age, Hana works very hard daily to satisfy her family’s needs. Ten years ago, she started to work at her domicile by selling sculptures, figures, and gifts such as kitchen appliances. She is well known with her products' diversification, originality and uniqueness. And today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase more products to sell and hence get superior income. As for her future plans, and since she learned many skills in this field, Hana thinks she will continue to be very successful, especially with the financial support that she will get from the loan.

loans.use: purchase more products

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a 23-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children attending school. She has worked as a private teacher since 2011 and she really knows how to teach her pupils since she is a fresh graduate. In order to enhance her skills and teaching tools, Mariam is seeking today to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to buy an educational encyclopedia. Mariam unfortunately is unable to afford the high cost of living and for this reason she is eager to receive the funds.

loans.use: to buy an educational encyclopedia

loans.name: Abdo

texts.en: Abdo is a 28-year-old married man living with his wife. He is the main provider for the family. He works on a freelance basis and owns a trolley on which he displays music CDs for sale. He started with this occupation in 2009 and he is barely gaining his living, knowing that during bad weather, he cannot proceed with his vending operations. Today Abdo is eager to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. He wants to purchase another bigger trolley and supply it with required products, with the aim of being able to put on the market a wider variety of products. He hopes that by doing this, he will earn a higher income.

loans.use: purchase another bigger trolley and supply it with required products

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 41 años, es casado. Su familia es unida, vive con su cónyuge y su menor hijo en casa propia en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Esta es una comunidad tranquila, dedicada principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Carlos se dedica a la venta de pescado fresco y venta de cerdos desde hace más de 05 años aproximadamente. Cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El destino del préstamo será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de pescado y cerdos para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con esto Carlos espera satisfacer los gustos y preferencias de sus clientes lo que le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ventas y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is 41 years old and married. His family is close-knit. His lives with his wife and his younger son in his own house in Cayaltí district, located in Chiclayo district, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. This is a peaceful community primarily working in agriculture, commerce and animal husbandry. 

Carlos has worked selling fresh fish and selling pigs for more than 5 years approximately. He has experience in the business and has very good personal and work references in the area. The loan will be destined for the purchase of a larger number of fish and pigs to increase the stock of his business. With this, Carlos expects to satisfy the tastes and preferences of his customers, which will allow him to increase his level of sales, and in turn, improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of fish and pigs to increase the stock of his business.

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en: Ernest is a married man who lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He deals in a retail shop and mechanics for income generation. He hopes to grow into a wholesaler, and he is honest and working hard toward it. Ernest is challenged by competition from similar businessmen and capital insufficiency. He is asking for a loan to buy a refrigerator for use in his business.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for use in his business.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with seven kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanasha operates a stall selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the Kes 30,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Kifalu

texts.en:
Kifalu is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over 20 years, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a Ugandan married hardworking man who lives in Kagadi, where he has been growing tea to supplement his income from cattle keeping. He hopes to plant more tea despite challenges of pests attacking his crops. Stephen is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides and pay for labour.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and pay for labour.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a 31-year-old single man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer, and at the same time, is earning a salary. He faces a challenge of price fluctuations; however, he has hopes of constructing a residential house. David needs a loan to buy doors to fix in his house.

loans.use: to buy doors to fix in his house.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a 37-year-old hardworking man living in Kagadi, Uganda. He trades produce and does farming to generate income. He hopes to grow his business though challenged by bad weather making roads impassable. Edward is asking for a loan to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Sandra Argentina

texts.es:
Doña Sandra es muy conocida ante sus vecinos por su pequeña tienda de cosméticos y lencería. Ella cuenta con una expresión de mucho agradecimiento con MiCrédito, KIVA y todas las personas que la apoyaron anteriormente para que su negocio fuese creciendo gracias a su esfuerzo y a los dos préstamos solicitados antes que le permitieron inyectar mercadería como cremas, perfumes, cosméticos y pinturas de labio. Ahora, a sus 62 años de edad expresa que siente que va por buen camino con su negocio de aproximadamente 20 años. 
Actualmente quiere seguir invirtiendo, por lo que solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar nueva mercadería como lencería, perfumes, cremas para la piel, maquillaje, entre otros productos de gran demanda. Doña Sandra planea ahorrar con estas nuevas ganancias que obtendrá con las ventas para reparar su concina y la vitrina donde exhibe su mercadería. Al finalizar de pagar este préstamo considera seguir invirtiendo y vendiendo para poder llegar a comprar una casa propia.
texts.en:
Sandra is well-known among her neighbors for her small cosmetics and lingerie store. She has a very grateful expression for MiCrédito, Kiva, and all the people who supported her before so that her business grew thanks to her efforts and the two loans she has requested previously, that allowed her to get more merchandise such as creams, perfumes, cosmetics, and lipstick. Now, at 62 years of age, she says that she feels she is on a good path with her business of approximately 20 years. 

Currently, she wants to continue investing, for which she asks for another loan to purchase new merchandise such as lingerie, perfumes, skin creams, and makeup among other high-demand products. Sandra plans to save these new earnings that she will get with the sales to fix her kitchen and the display case where she shows her merchandise. Upon paying off this loan, she is thinking about continuing to invest and making sales to be able to purchase her own house.

loans.use: to purchase lingerie, perfumes, skin creams, and makeup among other products.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of six children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees and transport.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes and shoes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation from the market to her place of business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 15,000 KES, she wants to purchase bales of clothes and shoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes and shoes for resale

loans.name: Heidi Lissett

texts.es:
Heidi, de 27 años de edad, estudió hasta 9° grado, está acompañada y su compañero de vida es albañil, sus dos hijos viven con ella y solo uno asiste a la escuela. 

Heidi, se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas en su casa, con él a poyo del ministerio de agricultura, se considera que está capacitada para producir verduras, para su alimentación y hasta para vender.- Además, tiene otro negocio de venta de artículos de limpieza para el hogar por revistas, a parte de los ingresos que genera su esposo con su trabajo.

Heidi, necesita el préstamo para comprar un terreno, para poder sembrar con mayor facilidad sus hortalizas.
 
El sueño de Heidi es, ser una productora de verduras a tiempo completo, porque con la compra del terreno podrá producir más hortalizas y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Heidi, 27 years old, went to school up to the 9th grade, is partnered, and her life partner is a bricklayer. Their two children live with her and only one goes to school. 

Heidi works growing vegetables at her house, with the support of the ministry of agriculture, she considers herself trained to produce vegetables for her own consumption and even to sell. In addition, she has another business of selling household cleaning supplies through magazines, apart from the income that her partner earns with his work. 

Heidi needs the loan to purchase land to be able to plant her vegetables more easily. 

Heidi's dream is to be a full-time vegetable producer, because with the purchase of the land, she will be able to produce more vegetables and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase land.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie is a 38-year-old mother with two children. She has a business selling sandwiches, sausage, and fried chicken in her community to earn a living. Julie requested a loan to buy bread, a box of sausage, a box of chicken, vegetable oil, a fry pan, and containers to help her run the business. She will expand her business using her profit. Julie became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy bread, a box of sausage, a box of chicken, vegetable oil, a fry pan, and containers

loans.name: Litia

texts.en: Litia is a 32-year-old mother with four children. She owns and operates a business in her village to earn a living. Litia has requested a loan to buy a sack of sugar, sack of rice, sack of flour, and a box of tinned fish to help her business. She has been doing this for more than two years. She will expand her business using her profits. Litia joined SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a sack of sugar, sack of rice, sack of flour, and a box of tinned fish

loans.name: Aifilifili

texts.en: Aifilifili is an 18-year-old mother with one child. She has a small business of vegetable gardening (cabbage, eggplant, cucumber, tomato) in her community to earn a living. Aifilifili has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds (cabbage, eggplant, cucumber, tomato), hand gloves, a wheelbarrow, rake, and shovel, to assist her in running the business. She has been doing this for more than a year. She will use her profit to expand her business and sell the vegetables in every store or export them overseas. Aifilifili became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds (cabbage, eggplant, cucumber, tomato), hand gloves, a wheelbarrow, rake, and shovel

loans.name: Maarifa Group

texts.en: Kassim is a businessman in his early 50s with six schooling children. He has a business of bricks. He has been in this business for 10 years now and is able to make a good profit each month. Kassim runs his business from 7 am to 6 pm daily. He is requesting a fifth loan through Tujijenge Tanzania, which he will use to buy cement, sand and water for making bricks. Kassim used the previous loans (all of which he paid back successfully) to increase stock in his business. His capital is now greater than before and he serves more people, though people still demand even more products. He dreams of adding more capital. Kassim gains a profit that he uses to cover school fees and home food expenses. He will share this loan with his loan group, Maarifa, which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy cement and water to make bricks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, shovel, rake, chemicals, wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves and safety boots

loans.name: Faatuli

texts.en: Faatuli is a 50-year-old mother with six children. She owns a small business selling chips in her community to earn a living. Faatuli has requested a loan to buy taro, banana, vegetable oil, plastic bags, fry pan, containers, wooden spoon, and a sack of salt to run the business. She hopes to use the profit to expand her business. Faatuli became a member of SPBD in 2009.

loans.use: to buy taro, banana, vegetable oil, plastic bags, fry pan, containers, wooden spoon, and a sack of salt

loans.name: Angel Rutilio

texts.es:
El señor Ángel de  48  años de edad es  casado  tiene dos  hijos que dependen de él, tiene casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 04  años al negocio de venta de llantas, lubricantes y accesorios para carro, también cuenta con servicios de taller.
Don Ángel su venta es de lunes a domingo en su taller el atiende diferentes clientes como por ejemplo los que llegan a reparar sus llantas, comprar lubricantes y los que llegan a buscar accesorios para su carro.
Don Ángel es una persona amable y servicial que desea salir adelante, está solicitando el préstamo para comprar llantas usadas, con el apoyo de este préstamo desea surtir  su negocio para esta época de navidad. Este es su tercer crédito que su sueño es mejorar su taller.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Ángel is 48 years old. He is married and has two children who are dependent on him. He has his own house, located in the community of San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras. For the past four years he has had a business selling tires, lubricants, and car accessories. He also provides mechanic services.

Ángel works from Monday through Sunday. In his workshop, he tends to many customers, for example those who come to get their tires repaired, to buy lubricants, and those to come to look for accessories for their cars. 

Ángel is a friendly and helpful person who wants to get ahead. He is requesting the loan to buy used tires. With the help of the loan, he wants to stock his business for the Christmas season. This is his third loan. His dream is to improve his workshop. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2014.

loans.use: to buy tires for his business.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is 28 years old. She is married to Gerson and together they have been blessed with two children. Gerson provides additional income for the family.

Millicent runs a retail shop, a business she has done for the last seven years, earning a monthly income of Kes 8,000.

Millicent has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of Kes 10,000, which she will use to add to her stock of retail goods. Such goods include sugar, tea leaves, rice, milk and washing powder.

With the anticipated profits, Millicent will be able to repay the loan as well as school fees for her children.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to improve and climb the success ladder a step at a time as her family prospers.

loans.use: to add stock of retail goods

loans.name: Ry

texts.en: Ry, who is 61 years old, is residing in Kampong Speu Province of Cambodia. She has five children in total, three are married and live independently while the other two are single and live under her support. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farm, which is located in her community. So far, she has been in this type of business for 20 years. Currently, she would like to request a Kiva loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can experience a convenient way of travelling. She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a Ugandan married man of 30 years. He lives in Kagadi where he operates a milling machine, saloon and a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He hopes to increase his family’s income through increased sales despite some mechanical breakdowns of his milling machine leading to income disparities. Since he is hardworking, Patrick is requesting a loan to buy spare parts for his machine.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his milling machine

loans.name: Lydia.

texts.en: Lydia is a married woman, age 59, who lives in Kagadi, Uganda, where she sells produce to earn income to support her family. She is hardworking. Her dream is setting up a retail shop since she is challenged by high transport costs. Lydia is asking for a loan to buy cassava to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava to sell.

loans.name: Felimar

texts.en: Felimar is 18 years old, and a second-year student studying Hospitality and Industry Management. She is determined to finish her education, but her parents are not able to sustain all her needs in school. So Felimar is now asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to pay her tuition fees and allowance to school. She hopes to maintain good standing in school to achieve her dreams and help lift her family out of poverty someday.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees and allowance for school

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 66-year-old hardworking widowed woman living in Kagadi, Uganda. She operates a retail shop along with produce selling to earn a living. She hopes to grow her retail business to a wholesale in spite of the challenges of competition from similar businesses. Mary intends to use the loan to buy drinks, sugar and other general merchandise for her business.

loans.use: to buy drinks, sugar and other general merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Christopher.

texts.en: Christopher is a 37-year-old hardworking Ugandan man living in Kagadi. He sells produce and earns a salary from employment as his income sources. He hopes to educate his children despite a challenge of competition hitting his business. Christopher intends to use the loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell

loans.name: Whuilmer Armando

texts.es:
Whuilmer es un joven de 29 años de edad que desde muy pequeño trabaja vendiendo verduras en el mercado, ya que desde temprana edad ha sido todo un emprendedor. Él empezó ayudando en un tramo, trabajo que le permitió obtener experiencia e ir ahorrando hasta lograr establecer desde hace diez años su propio negocio como comerciante de verduras.
Este emprendedor comerciante cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja, quien también trabaja con él en el mercado. A Whuilmer le encantaría dar a conocer sus productos en distintos súper mercados del país, pero primero quiere seguir invirtiendo en su pequeño tramo, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar lechuga, zanahoria, ayote, papas, tomate, entre otras verduras de gran demanda. Entre otros planes está conseguir mayor diversidad de legumbres para innovar en el mercado.
texts.en:
Whuilmer is a 29-year-old young man who, since he was very little, has worked selling vegetables in the market, and since this early age he has been an entrepreneur. He began helping in a stall, work that allowed him to gain experience and save until he was able to establish his own business ten years ago as a vegetable seller. 

This enterprising businessman has the support of his spouse, who also works with him in the market. Whuilmer would love to get his products known in different supermarkets in the country, but first he needs to continue investing in his small stall, for which he asks for a loan to purchase lettuce, carrots, squash, potatoes, and tomatoes among other high-demand vegetables. Among his other plans are to get a wider diversity of vegetables to innovate in the market.

loans.use: to purchase lettuce, carrots, squash, potatoes, and tomatoes among other vegetables.

loans.name: Edinson

texts.es:
Edison es un joven de 21 años de edad, el cual tiene un hijo de 1 año de edad, lo más bonito de la historia es que gracias a su suegro tiene una actividad económica, él lo adopto como un hijo y le enseño todo sobre la ganadería.
Desde entonces Edison  vela por los gastos de su pareja de su hijo y ayuda en su casa, pero hay un inconveniente y es que la ganadería demanda grandes gastos que en muchas ocasiones no son sostenibles y por ello solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos, vacunas, cuido para complementar su alimentación y lo más importante comprar un ganado para ampliar sus existencias de animales.
Su sueño es poder ser un ganadero profesional con mercancía y poder generar los ingresos para vivir cómodamente junto con su pareja e hijo.
texts.en:
Edison is a young 21-year-old man, and he has a one-year-old son. The nicest part of his story is that, thanks to his father-in-law, he has an occupation. Edison's father-in-law adopted him like a son and taught him everything about ranching.

Since then, Edison has ensured that the expenses of his partner, his son, and help in his house are taken care of. However, there is an issue, and it's that ranching entails large expenses that in many cases aren't sustainable. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to purchase supplies, vaccines, and care to supplement his food. The most important reason for this loan, however, is for Edison to buy livestock to increase the number of animals he has.

His dream is to be a professional rancher with merchandise, and to be able to generate enough income to live comfortably with his partner and son.

loans.use: to buy supplies, vaccines, and care to supplement the food for his animals.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Thirty-five year old Analyn is a Vitaplus dealer.  She sells Vitaplus, a natural health drink that boosts energy to the body. It has various flavors that suit every customer's taste and preferences. She is a  married woman with five children, living in the town of  Mayorga, Leyte.  Four of her children are still attending school. She has been engaged in this kind of business for three years now.

Analyn has requested a loan to buy additional stocks of Vita-plus with a variety of flavors. These stocks will help her sell more and this will improve her income. She can now re-invest her profit to any possible business venture to have an additional source of income.

In the future, Analyn would like to expand her current business to support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of vitaplus with variety of flavors

loans.name: Marina Raquel

texts.es:
Marina, de 52 años de edad, estudió hasta 4° grado, se casó cuando tenía 18 años y 22 años después quedo viuda debido a una emfermedad terminal que le arrebato la vida de su esposo, quedando Marina, con cinco hijos, de los cuales todos están acompañados, ella vive solo con tres nietos de su primera hija, que también es viuda. 

Marina se dedica a la venta de tamales de distintas variedades y los hace dos veces por semana.- Además, lava ropa ajena, los días que no hace tamales. Una de sus hijas, le ayuda económicamente, pero no es suficiente ya que ella trabaja limpiando casas en la ciudad y es poco lo que le pagan.
 
El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar materiales como alambre # 10, poliducto y una caja térmica para instalar energía eléctrica en su casa, porque nunca había tenido este servicio.

Uno de los sueños de Marina es tener energía eléctrica y tener servicio de agua potable, para no caminar grandes distancias para obtener este vital líquido.
texts.en:
Marina is 52 years old. She studied up to Grade 4. She got married at 18 and 22 years later she was left a widow due to a terminal illness that took her husband's life leaving Marina with 5 children. All of them are in relationships. She lives alone with 3 grandchildren of her first daughter who is also a widow.

Marina works selling tamales of different types. She does this twice a week. She also washes clothes for others on the days when she doesn't make tamales. One of her daughters helps her economically, but it's not much as she works cleaning houses in the city and she gets paid little.

The loan will be used to buy materials like #10 electrical wiring, plastic tubing and a thermal breaker to install electrical energy in her house. One of Marina's dreams is to have electricity and potable water so she doesn't have to travel a long ways to get this vital liquid.

loans.use: to buy materials like NO 10 wire, plastic tubing and a thermal breaker to install electricity in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bread, a box of sausage, box of chicken, vegetable oil, frying pan, and containers

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina is a 34-year-old mother with one child. She has a business of selling sandwiches, sausage, and fried chicken in her community to earn a living. Lina has requested a loan to buy bread, a box of sausage, box of chicken, vegetable oil, frying pan, and containers to assist her in running the business. She will expand her business using her profit. Lina became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy bread, a box of sausage, box of chicken, vegetable oil, frying pan, and containers

loans.name: Savan

texts.en:
Savan, 42 years old, is a lovely father of two children. He lives in a small community of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. To make a living, he has been working as a high school teacher since 1989. On average, he is able to make an income of USD 5.00 per day. 

Savan is living in an old house and he wants to build a comfortable one for his family. Due to the shortage of his budget, he is now applying for a Kiva loan through HKL to buy timber and build a wooden house. Through this loan, he hopes he can experience living in a comfortable house. He is thankful to all the lenders with their financial support of poor people.

loans.use: to buy timber and build a wooden house

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Sina is a 30-year-old woman with one child. She owns a small business selling elei printing materials at the market to earn a living. Sina requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, elei designs, containers, and a printing machine, to assist her to run the business. She has been doing this for more than two years. Sina hopes to build a small elei shop in her village in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint, a paint brush, elei design, containers, and a printing machine,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a box of sausage, box of chicken, bottle of mushroom soy sauce, onions, plates, aluminum foil, tomato sauce

loans.name: Elmer Adrian

texts.es:
Elmer,  de 42 años de edad, estudió administración de empresas, es casado, su esposa trabaja en un banco nacional, tienen dos hijas. 
Elmer, trabaja administrando un agroservicio, tiene doce años de dedicarse al negocio.

Elmer, también se dedica a vender y promocionar herramientas industriales a gobiernos municipales del país, él tiene que viajar largas distancias para promocionar las herramientas, el trabajo lo realiza con ayuda de un hermano y no tiene un horario fijo. 

El necesita comprar 500 bloques, 3 bolsas de cemento, para construir una bodega y guardar las herramientas que necesita para hacer los proyectos que hace con las municipalidades, de esta manera Elmer, podrá tener más espacio en su casa, para evitar un accidente con sus hijas.

Elmer, sueña con trabajar en una gran empresa, para poder asegurar el futuro de sus hijas, por las cuales el sale a trabajar cada día, y poder cumplir el sueño de verlas en la universidad.
texts.en:
Elmer is 42 years old, married, and he has two daughters. He studied business administration and now manages an agricultural service center. He's done this work for a period of twelve years. His wife works at a national bank.

He also earns a living advertising and selling industrial tools to municipal governments in the country. This requires him to travel long distances without regularly scheduled hours. He does this work with the help of a brother.

He needs to buy 500 blocks and three bags of cement to build a storage room where he will keep the tools he uses for his projects with the municipalities. This will give him more space in his home as well as prevent any mishap involving his daughters.

Elmer dreams of working for a big company so that he can ensure the future for his daughters. He goes to work every day to fulfill the dream of seeing them attend university.

loans.use: to buy 500 blocks and three bags of cement to build a storage room where he will keep the tools he needs for his work projects.

loans.name: Fanny Beatriz

texts.es: A sus 27 años de edad Beatriz es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 2 años, ella vive en la casa de sus padres y ahí hay un espacio donde puede criar animales menores, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chachos  para mejorar su negocio y de las ganancias que le queden piensa construir una chanchera y que esto le permita darle lo necesario a su hijo.
texts.en: At 27 years old, Beatríz is a single mother. She has a son who is 2 years old. She lives in her parents' house and has a space there where she can raise small animals. She will invest the loan in the purchase of pigs so she can improve her business. With the earnings, she plans to build a pig corral and this will allow her provide the necessities for her son.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Cherry Mae

texts.en:
Cherry Mae owns and operates a sari-sari(variety) store, selling various household commodities like powdered milk, canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and beverages. She is a 32 year old married woman with three children ages 13, 7 and 4 year old, respectively.  Her husband earns a living by being a fish vendor. He sells fish.

She is  asking for a loan to buy 10 buckets of fresh fish and additional stocks for the store. These will help Cherry Mae and her family augment her livelihood. She can cater to the needs of her customers. She can then provide her children with nutritious diets and better living conditions.

She is hoping that she can expand her current livelihood and hopefully venture into other businesses to improve their status of living.

loans.use: to buy 10 buckets of fresh fish and additional stocks for the store

loans.name: Fenumiai

texts.en:
Fenumiai is a 31-year-old mother with 2 children. She runs and operates a small business selling pancakes, buns, and pork cakes in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 1 year. 

Fenumiai has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, a frying pan, a wooden spoon, a bottle of vegetable oil, and plastic bags to assist her in running the business. She hopes to use her profits to build a small bakery in the near future and provide for her children's education. 

Fenumiai became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, a frying pan, a wooden spoon, a bottle of vegetable oil, and plastic bags.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto, de 60 años de edad, es una persona de principios, destacado por su alto compromiso con la comunidad y servicio a los demás, ejerce  el cargo de profesor en el centro escolar de su comunidad, él se creció con sus padres y sus abuelos, ellos se dedicaban a los trabajos de agricultura y ganadería.

Roberto, se dedicaba realizar tareas agrícolas y de ganadería por las mañanas y por las tardes estudiaba.- Luego creció y continúo sus estudios en la universidad nacional, hasta graduarse de licenciado en educación. 

Roberto, tiene más de 15 años trabajando como profesor, lo cual lo llena de satisfacción y de orgullo, ser parte de la educación de los niños y niñas de su comunidad, también se desempeña como presidente de la asociación de desarrollo comunal.

El dinero será utilizado para el mejoramiento de su vivienda, aprovechando que estamos en época de verano, necesita hacer esas reparaciones urgentemente, principalmente el techo de su casa.- De esta manera dará una vivienda segura a su familia. 

Las proyecciones que él tiene para su futuro son, tener su casa terminada y con todas las condiciones para el descanso y protección de su familia.
texts.en:
Roberto, 60 years old, is a person of principles. Noted for his high level of dedication to his community and service to others, he is a teacher in the town's school. He was raised by his parents and grandparents, who worked in agriculture and cattle raising.

Roberto grew up doing agricultural and cattle work in the mornings and studying in the afternoons. When he grew up, he continued his studies in the national university until he graduated with a bachelor's in education.

Roberto has been working for more than 15 years as a teacher, which fills him with satisfaction and pride at being a part of the eduction of the boys and girls of his community. He also works as the president of the communal development association.

The money will be used for improvements to his house, taking advantage of the summer season. He urgently needs to make these repairs, mostly to the roof of his house. In this way he will provide a safe home for his family.

His plans for the future are to finish his house with all of the conditions needed for rest and for the protection of his family.

loans.use: to make repairs to his house.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes engages in the hog raising business. She raises and sells hogs.  Due to high prices of commodities, she engages in a food vending business to augment her income. She is a 41-year-old married woman from Mayorga, Leyte. She is the mother of eight children, six of whom are still attending school. She has been engaged in this kind of business for 10 years now.

She is asking for a loan to purchase three additional piglets, pig feed and vitamins. Surely these tools are of great help in improving Lourdes' way of living. In the coming few months, she could now sell pigs. With these, she will continue to pay for the school expenses of her children and provide them with nutritious food as well.

She dreams that she could be successful in handling her current sources of income to continue to support the education of her children, so they can have a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase three additional piglets, pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Virgen De Las Nieves Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE LAS NIEVES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia es la Sra. Consuelo ella es viuda y tiene 58 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y por medio de este negocio quiere sacara adelante a sus hijos, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 10 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras. 


Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de celulares, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank "Virgen de las Nieves" (Virgin of the Snows). This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is part of the province and department of Cusco.

One member is Señora Consuelo. She is a widow and is 58 years old, with 4 children. She works in her restaurant business. She is an entrepreneurial woman, and through this business she wants to raise her children. She prepares various dishes such as chicken with potatoes, soups, and meat and vegetable specialties. She works from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm. She has already had this business for 10 years, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her restaurant business. She is applying for the loan in order to purchase products for cooking such as chicken, meat, and vegetables.

The other members have businesses of selling clothing, selling cell phones, a grocery store, and a restaurant.

This member is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this means, and she promises to make her payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy products to cook, such as chicken, meat, and vegetables.

loans.name: Saran's Group

texts.en: Saran’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Saran makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor and construction worker to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Phal's Group

texts.en: Phal’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Phal makes a living cultivating rice and she does extra work as a policewoman to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a hardworking Ugandan married man living in Kagadi, age 41 years, with eight children. He sells produce and rears goats for better household income. He hopes to grow his business despite price fluctuations. Stephen is requesting a loan to buy maize and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and rice to sell

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en: Teopista is a hardworking Ugandan married lady living in Kagadi. She sells clothes in a boutique to supplement her daily income from farming and a banana plantation. She hopes to grow her business despite challenges of competition from similar businesses. She intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Naume

texts.en: Naume is a hardworking single woman living in Kagadi, Uganda. She operates a bar along with farming to earn a living. She hopes to grow her business in spite of the challenges of competition from similar businesses. Naume intends to use the loan to buy drinks for her business.

loans.use: to buy drinks for her business.

loans.name: Boaz

texts.en: Boaz is a married and honest man living in Kagadi, Uganda. He operates a hardware shop and practices farming as his other source of income. Despite capital insufficiency, Boaz is hopeful of his business growth and is asking for a loan to buy cement, nails and iron bars to sell.

loans.use: to buy cement, nails and iron bars to sell

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en: Johnson is a Ugandan honest and friendly single man living in Kagadi. He deals in motor vehicle transport and produce selling to earn income. He hopes to build a permanent house despite challenges of a lot of accidents. Johnson is requesting a loan to buy tyres and a battery for his car.

loans.use: to buy tyres and a battery for his car.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex, who operates a clinic, is a married man living in Kagadi, Uganda. He started his business to supplement the income he earns from civil service. He desires to grow his clinic despite challenges of competition. Alex is asking for a loan to buy medicine for his clinic.

loans.use: to buy pharmaceutical drugs for his clinic.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a Ugandan married hardworking man who lives in Kagadi, where he has been selling alcohol to supplement his income from farming. He hopes for his business to grow despite challenges of high transport costs reducing his profit margin. John is requesting a loan to buy alcohol to sell.

loans.use: to buy alcohol to sell

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en: Gerald is a Ugandan married man who lives in Kagadi, where he sells produce and practices farming to earn a living. He hopes to educate his family’s children through increased sales despite bad weather changes leading to income disparities. Since he is hardworking, Gerald is requesting a loan to buy cassava and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava and maize to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy power saw

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past six years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan of 10,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Azimjon

texts.ru:
Азимчон трудолюбивый мужчина 36 лет. Он родился в семье художника. Азимчон женат и  имеет двоих детей. Они живут в благоустроенном доме из двух комнат. В дехканском хозяйстве «Ниджоникент» имеет 2.5 гектара земли,  из них 0.4 гектар винограда и 2.1 гектара для выращивания селхозкультур,  в том числе лук, дыню и пшеницы. В дехканстве ему помогает жена и его сыновья. Также он занимается животноводством. Азимчон имеет две головы крупнорогатого скота и пять голов овец. Он мастер на все руки. В свободное время он работает столяром плотником. 
    Сейчас Азимчон хочет расширить бизнес, именно по выращиванию сельхозкультуры. Но у него недостаточно собственных денежных средств, чтобы закупить семена для посева урожая. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет взять кредит для закупа семян для посева. Азимчон очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Azimjon is a hard-working person, 36 years of age. He was born in the family of an artist. Azimjon is married and has two children. His family lives in a modern two-room house. Azimjon has 2.5 ha [6 acres] of land in the Nijonikent cooperative farm. He uses 0.4 ha to grow grapes and 2.1 ha to grow farm produce, such as onions, melons and wheat. His family and sons help him on the farm. Azimjon also raises livestock. He has two heads of cattle and five heads of sheep. Azimjon is very resourceful and handy at many thanks. In his free time he also works as a carpenter and cabinet maker.

At present Azimjon would like to expand his farming business. However, he lacks own funds to buy seeds for planting. This is why he has applied to Arvand for a loan to buy seeds for planting. Azimjon really hopes for a positive outcome and thanks Arvand for its support in advance.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Gilberto Antonio

texts.es:
Gilberto, de 50 años de edad, estudió hasta 6° grado, está acompañado, tiene una niña de 10 años de edad, cuando se generó la guerra, el no tuvo otra opción que emigrar a la ciudad buscando seguridad para su familia; hace tres años volvió a la comunidad, huyendo de la delincuencia que afecta en la ciudad. 

Gilberto, se dedica a realizar varios trabajos, como son la agricultura, las estructuras metálicas, trabajo que aprendió cuando vivía en la ciudad; también, tiene 20 años de experiencia en la albañilería.- Es así como a logrado sacar adelante a su familia.

Gilberto, necesita el dinero para comprar ladrillos, lamina, madera y para pagar la mano de obra, que le ayudará en la construcción de su casa, ya que donde vive es una casa provisional.

El sueño de Gilberto es, construir su casa y gozar de buena salud para poder seguir trabajando, para darles mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Gilberto, who is 50 years old, studied until the 6th grade. He has a partner, and a ten-year-old daughter. When the war began, he had no choice but to move to the city, looking for safety for his family. Three years ago, he returned to his community, fleeing the crime that affects the city. 
Gilberto has several occupations, such as agriculture; metal structures, a job he learned when he lived in the city; and he also has 20 years of experience in construction work. This is how he has managed to help his family get ahead.
Gilberto needs the money to buy bricks, laminate, wood, and to pay the workers who will help him build his house, because where he lives now is only temporary. 
Gilberto’s dream is to build his home and enjoy good health to be able to keep working, to give better life conditions to his family.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, laminate, wood, and to pay the workers who will help him build his house.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with six children.  Her youngest child is five years old. She hails from the town of Dulag, Leyte.  She raises and sells hogs to earn a living. To augment her income, she operates a hollow block business. She has been engaged in this kind of business for eight years already. Her husband earns an income by being a driver.

She is in need of capital to finance her present business. Grace is asking for a loan to buy additional pigs and cement for the renovation of the pig pen.  Hopefully, she will be successful in raising and selling more pigs. Slowly, Grace can run both her livelihoods again for the welfare of her growing children.

She is determined to be successful in handling her business to be able to provide her family with better living condition and support her children's education as well.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs and cement for the renovation of  her pig pen

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra operates a pot-pot(a local version of tricycle that will carry two passengers  with the used of pedals.  She is a married woman with four young children.  Her husband is a farmer. The income from his yield will help pay for family's expenses. Aside from operating a pot-pot, she raises and sells hogs.

Myra has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy pig feed and vitamins, and maintenance for the pot-pot, like lubricants and an extra tire. These are essential tools in making her ride smooth and hassle free. She will be raising healthy hogs in the coming few months.  She can continue the support and education of her children and be able to provide for their daily needs.

 She is hoping that she can expand her business to be productive for the improvement of her livelihood and to be successful in life.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and vitamins, and maintenance for the pot-pot, like lubricants and an extra tire

loans.name: Arlan

texts.en:
His name is Arlan, 21, and a resident of Cavite, Philippines.  He is married to Mary Joy and has two kids who are not of school age yet.  Arlan works hard to provide for the household and personal needs of his young family.

Arlan has operated a tricycle for four years already. His tricycle carries up to four passengers. In the Philippines especially in the provinces like Cavite, a tricycle is a common means of transportation. Jeepneys and buses are limited . Very few people own a vehicle. The townspeople usually ride a tricycle from their homes to market, church, to their friend’s homes and to other destinations within their community. They even use that transport from one town to the other.  Arlan earns a minimum of Php 500 a day. 

To help him continue his transport business, he is requesting a Php 10,000 loan which he will use to pay for gas and maintenance of his tricycle.  He is positive that this will boost his income, as tricycle transportation is really a necessity in their area. 

Arlan plans to buy another tricycle unit and  dreams to be successful in his business so he can give his family a much better life. He aims to send his children to good schools. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and were he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of his tricycle unit.

loans.name: Reyna Noemy

texts.es:
Reyna, con el crédito anterior compro una máquina de coser nueva, lo que le permite seguir elaborando prendas de vestir con mayor calidad, cuenta con la satisfacción de sus clientes y su núcleo familiar se mantiene.
Nuevamente solicita ayuda a los inversionistas Kiva para que le presten capital y así poder comprar telas, zippers, agujas, hijos, botones, etc.,  con los que cubrirá las demandas de sus clientes y continuara teniendo una fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
With the previous loan, Reyna purchased a new sewing machine, which allows her to continue making higher quality garments.  Her customers are satisfied and she is supporting her family.

She is requesting help from the Kiva lenders again, so that they might lend her the capital that will enable her to purchase fabric, zippers, needles, thread, buttons, etc.  With these items, she will meet her customers’ demands and continue having a source of income.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, zippers, needles, thread, buttons, etc., with which she will meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Eang's Group

texts.en: Eang’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Eang makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Sunly's Group

texts.en: Sunly’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sunly makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Doeun's Group

texts.en: Doeun’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Doeun makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Thai's Group

texts.en: Thai’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Thai makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a farmer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and this man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Patrick.

texts.en: Patrick is a 37-year-old married man with five children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a fish monger in Bundibugyo, and this is his major source of income. He also has cocoa gardens. He started the business in 1998, and he gets a lot of money to look after his family. He is a very hardworking man. He wants a loan to buy fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
Alfonso tiene 38 años de edad, es casado, vive junto a su cónyuge y sus tres menores hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Pimpingos, ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú. Su población se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de café, crianza de ganado vacuno y comercio.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de café de variedad catimore, cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento a su cultivo de café así como para la contratación de mano de obra para su cosecha. Con esto Alfonso espera mejorar la productividad de su negocio ofreciendo un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que se verá reflejado en su nivel de ventas e incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Alfonso is 38 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and their three minor children in their own house, which is made of rustic materials and is located in the district of Pimpingos, in the province of Cutervo in the Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru. The people there work in agriculture, especially in growing coffee, raising cattle, and commerce.

He works in agriculture, especially in raising coffee of the Catimor variety. He has experience in the business, as well as very good personal and work references in the zone. He has applied for a loan to purchase compost and fertilizers in order to give suitable maintenance to his coffee crop, as well as to hire labor for the harvest. With this, Alfonso hopes to improve the productivity of his business, offering a better product to his customers, which will be reflected in his level of sales and will increase his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase compost and fertilizer to maintain his coffee planting and also to hire labor for the harvest

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase onions

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is an ambitious man and looks to a future when he is the leading supplier of milk in his area. He's working 12 to 14 hours a day to fulfill his dream. Victor lives with his wife and says that they only want to have more children when they are sure that they can raise them without worry of where their next meal will come from, or forcing them to leave school because they can't provide for them. 

Victor owns a small plot of inherited land on which he has been practicing mixed farming for more than 10 years. He grows a variety of crops and keeps dairy cows and poultry. The income he makes from selling milk, eggs and crops is insufficient to meet his family's expenses. He needs to improve his income level, and that is why he is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow. Victor passionately loves dairy farming and as he likes to put it “dairy farming is close to my heart”. He plans not to buy just an ordinary cow but to buy a quality breed of cow that will produce between 10-20 litres of milk a day. The additional milk will result in additional income and hence improved living conditions. The income generated from selling the milk will be used to fully repay the loan and to educate his children. He will also benefit from cow manure, which will be used to increase the fertility level of his farm, hence increasing productivity. Through the loan, he will also be able to build a biogas digester that will be helpful in saving energy. This loan will completely change his life and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy up-to-date salon products and meet her customers' requirements.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in a spare parts business where he earns a living, although he also carries out farming to earn extra income. He started this business to generate funds and satisfy his family's needs. He has hardships of price fluctuations and inadequate capital, however he hopes to expand his business and construct a good residential house in the future.

He is requesting a loan to buy more spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts to sell

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Leo is a hardworking man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in livestock rearing alongside farming to earn extra income. He started this business in order to educate his children.  He hopes to be a prominent businessman, however his main challenge is inadequate capital to meet the increasing demands. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more cattle to add to his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to add to his farm.

loans.name: Enid Shalon

texts.en:
Enid is a 33-year-old hardworking married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She runs a salon as her main source of income, alongside farming, to earn extra income. She started this business in order to to look after her family and educate her children. She hopes to educate her children to higher levels of education and have a booming business, however her main challenge is high rental license and inadequate capital. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more hair pieces, hair oil and a dryer for her business.

loans.use: to buy more hair pieces, hair oil and a dryer for her business.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Maria Fe is 20 years old and is youngest of the six children in the family. Her mother, Lucresia, a member of NWTF, supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.

Maria Fe is completing a Bachelor of Science in Elementary Education and is currently in the last year of this 4-year course.

Lucresia is borrowing 6,400 PHP to pay her daughter's tuition fees for the second semester of the 2014-15 school year.

Maria Fe plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition fees.

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en: Reuben is a 28-year-old married man with two children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has a pub that sells sodas and beer. He also has a shop that sells clothes in Bundibugyo. He is a hardworking man who loves his business. He wants a loan to buy sodas and beer, especially to sell on Christmas.

loans.use: to buy sodas and beer for resale

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 37-year-old married man with five children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has a retail shop selling general merchandise in Bundibugyo. He also has a cocoa garden that supplements his income from the shop. He hopes to educate his children. He is challenged by capital which is inadequate.
He wants a loan to buy merchandise for his shop.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for resale

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a hardworking married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She owns a retail shop as her main source of income, although she also does farming as her side income. It is from these businesses that she has been able to sustain her family and take care of her children. Price fluctuations and inadequate capital are her main challenges but she hopes to become rich.

She is requesting a loan to buy more sodas, salt, soap and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy more sodas, salt, soap and other items to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 35-year-old hardworking married man with two children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He runs a retail shop as his main source of income although he also earns income from produce. He started this business to develop himself and improve the standard of living. He has hardships of price fluctuations and inadequate capital, however he hopes to expand his business and become self employed.

He is requesting a loan to buy items like soap, sweets, sugar and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy items like soap, sweets, sugar and other items to sell.

loans.name: Ediltrudes

texts.en:
Ediltrudes is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ediltrudes is 46 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Ediltrudes has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ediltrudes has been in this business for 11 years. Ediltrudes would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Mkwaphasa

texts.en:
Mkwaphasa is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es:
Luz Dary es una mujer soltera de 48 años de edad que siempre mostro gran interés por el trabajo independiente, se dedica a la venta de mercancía como acolchados y ropa tanto para hombre como para dama y gracias a estas ventas independientes ha podidos generar los ingresos en su hogar que lo terminan de conformar sus dos hijos.
Esos dos hijos que para Luz Dary lo significan todo son los que la inspiran a superarse cada día  y es por ellos que quiere mejorar sus ventas y hacer un doble esfuerzo para generar los ingresos suficientes para que puedan acceder a una educación superior.
Pensando en llevar a sus hijos a la universidad Luz Dary quiere solicitar un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de acolchados y artículos decorativos para el hogar y ropa para mujer.
texts.en:
Luz Dary is a single woman, 48 years old. She has always shown a great interest in working independently. She sells merchandise such as blankets and clothing for men and women. Thanks to these independent sales, she has been able to generate income for her household, which constists of her two children.

These two children mean everything to Luz Dary and they are what inspire her to work hard each day. It is for them that she wants to improve her sales and work twice as hard to generate enough income so that they can have access to higher education.

Planning to send her children to university, Luz Dary wants to request a loan that she will invest in the purchase of blankets and decorative items for the home and women's clothing.

loans.use: to buy blankets and decorative items.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic household commodities like noodles, soap, canned goods, toothpaste, coffee, cooking oil and many other items. She is a 53-year-old married woman with five children. Two are still attending school. To augment her income, Yolanda also raises and sells hogs.  Aside from that she engages in a vegetable vending business.

She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy assorted stocks for the store, obtain additional capital for vegetable vending and buy pig feed. These tools are very important in re-starting her sources of income. These will eventually help attract more customers to visit and purchase at her store as well as enable her to raise and sell more hogs in the coming months.

Yolanda hopes that with her determination to properly handle her business, it will be productive and successful. Through this, she can continue to finance the education of her two children for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy assorted stocks for the store, obtain additional capital for vegetable vending and buy pig feed

loans.name: Mirian Del Rocio

texts.es:
Mirian tiene 27 años de edad es soltera tiene dos hijos de 7 y 5 años vive en San Miguel provincia de Bolivar en la comunidad Santo Cristian.
Ella es madre soltera y necesita sustentar a sus hijos se dedica a la agricultura, solicita el credito para la compra de insumos agricolas para sembrar maiz y mejorar la produccion.Realiza las compras en San Miguel cada 15 días, su sueño es tener un negocio propio para asi mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia, en su tiempo libre va a la iglesia por que es muy creyente.
texts.en:
Mirian is 27 years old. She is single, and she has two children ages 7 and 5.  She lives in San Miguel, in the province of Bolívar, in the community of Santo Cristian.

She is a single mother and she needs to provide for her children.  She works in agriculture, and she is requesting a loan for the purchase of agricultural supplies in order to plant corn and improve the production.  She makes her purchases every 15 days.  Her dream is to have a business of her own in order to improve her family’s quality of life.  

In her free time she goes to church because she is very religious.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Maritza Esperanza

texts.es:
Maritza, actualmente tiene mayores demandas de tortillas y su inventario no es el suficiente para cubrirlas y como sabe que los créditos son de gran ayuda para mejorar su negocio, opta por solicitar un nuevo financiamiento para invertir en maíz, cal, leña y gas propano al por mayor, continuara trabajando y ahorrara en la compra.
Maritza está satisfecha por los buenos resultados de la inversión anterior, su situación financiera  está mejorando, sigue aportando para cubrir las necesidades básicas familiares y ha logrado cancelar parte de sus deudas.
texts.en:
Maritza currently has greater demand for tortillas, and her inventory is not sufficient to cover this demand. Since she knows that the loans are of great help in improving her business, she has decided to request a new loan to invest in corn, lime, firewood and propane gas on a wholesale basis. She will be able to continue working and she will save money on the purchase. 

Maritza is satisfied with the good results of the previous investment. Her financial situation is improving, she is continuing to contribute to covering her family's basic needs, and she has succeeded in paying part of her debts.

loans.use: to invest in corn, lime, firewood and propane gas on a wholesale basis, so she can keep working and save money on the purchase.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is an industrious mother from Mayorga, Leyte.  She is a 36-year-old married woman with four children aged 12, 11, 10 and 4 years old. She goes hog raising. She raises and sells hogs as her means of living. To have an additional source of income, she sells tuba (coconut wine).

Rowena has requested a loan to buy additional pigs, pig feed and additional supplies of tuba (coconut wine).  These will help Rowena improve her hog raising business and create greater income. She can now provide her family with good food and live better shelter.

In the future, she hopes that she can expand both of her businesses to be successful for the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs, pig feed and additional supplies of tuba (coconut wine)

loans.name: Leviano

texts.en:
Leviano is a 49-year-old hardworking married man with four children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He carries out farming to earn income in addition to selling alcohol. He started this business so as to generate funds and meet his personal goals. He hopes to be a prominent businessman and buy a motor vehicle, however his main challenge is inadequate capital. 

Leviano is requesting for a loan to buy fertilizers and seedlings for his farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is an old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He operates a produce store alongside farming to earn extra income. He started this business to look after his family.  He hopes to expand his business, however he faces a challenge of competition and inadequate capital. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more coffee to stock in preparation for the next season.

loans.use: to buy more coffee to stock in preparation for the next season.

loans.name: Rodolfo Alexander

texts.es:
Rodolfo, de 24 años de edad, es un joven esforzado, estudió hasta bachillerato, es soltero y sin hijos, vive junto con su madre, quien es dueña de una tienda ubicada en su casa.

Rodolfo, se dedica a la compra y venta de vehículos, inició trabajando en un taller automotriz después de haber culminado sus estudios de bachillerato, en dicho taller trabajó por 3 años, estando ahí aprendió el negocio del comercio de carros usados; que consiste en comprarlos, repararlos y venderlos por un precio mayor y es por eso que decidió independizarse. Actualmente, parquea los carros afuera de su casa, con un rotulo que dice ¨se vende¨.

El préstamo solicitado es para completar el dinero que necesita para comprar un vehículo que le están vendiendo en buen precio.

El sueño mas grande que tiene Rodolfo es, que su negocio siempre siga creciendo, para llegar a tener un auto-lote con muchos carros, que le generen buenos ingresos y así gozar de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rodolfo, who is 24 years old, is a hard-working young man. He studied until high-school, he is single and has no children, he lives with this mother, who owns a shop located in their home. 
Rodolfo’s occupations is the purchase and sale of vehicles. He started working in a car workshop after finishing his high-school studies. He worked in that workshop for 3 years, there he learned the business of selling used cars, which consists in buying them, repairing them, and selling them for a higher price, which is why he decided to become independent. Currently, he parks the cars in front of his house, with a sign that says “for sale.”
The requested loan is to reach the amount of money he needs to buy a vehicle that he is getting at a good price. 
Rodolfo’s biggest dream is that his business keeps growing, to have a car lot with many cars that generate good income, and enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to reach the amount of money he needs to buy a vehicle that he is getting at a good price.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en: Zuhro is a goal-oriented woman. She lives in a rural area. She is married. She has four children. For about six years, she has been in a business. She is a hardworking, generous, nice person. She has a business buying and selling a livestock. She is sick now. She needs treatment in the hospital. She does not have any support to be treated. She is asking for support for her treatment. She needs to get medical treatment in the hospital.

loans.use: To receive treatment in the hospital

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.en:
Hilaria started her business in 2000 with her own working capital of $700.  She had a lot of difficulties because she did not have good management for her business. So she has one idea: to request a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her management. She said with borrowed money she could count the income and expenditure in one day.
